												Big time sink if you plan on playing this game.  It is a good game however, the amount of things you can do is quite high, the combat is challenging and you feel good when you flawlessly finish a good fight.  Takes a long time to become powerful, and there is a definate pay to win strategy.  Although everything you'd ever need can be obtained without spending a dime.The community is mostly younger folk, teenages and even younger.  The games economy is mostly fashion based, with the rarest gear being clothing usually with no bonuses, just flashy.  All in all i'd say a good game and worth checking out, the art/play style is unique to any mmo i've played, the combat is challenging and the amount of things to do will keep you busy for years.  8/10.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 21, 2014
												Mabinogi is quite possibly the most unique MMORPG I know, comparable to Blade & Soul.  Literally anything you want, you do.  Want to murder things with the most intimidating equipment?  Beat things with a stick?  Send meteors on your foe?  Go ahead!  There is an open world to explore, a variety of skills to master, and exceptionally well-done storylines across multiple generations.  An active player community, an active economy, and much more.  There's also music.  From Lute, to Flute, to Pianos and electric guitars, make your music and play it with impunity.  Getting bored with the game?  Here, have an event to spice things up.  Finished all the storylines?  Here, we've been working on this new one for a while.  Mastered all the talents?  Let's toss another one in here.  Mastered that too?  Let's combine them into a new one we call an Ace.  Not to mention are the three races, Human, Giant, and Elf, which specialize in whatever they do, but nothing really limits you in becoming Grandmaster anything, except maybe archery for Giants.It's an experience to play, but the learning curve is oddly shaped.  Familiar to some, hard for others, but still odd in its own way.  It soon becomes second nature over time, though.  Other than that, I give this game the highest of scores, and encourage those interested to play, and hopefully stay long enough to enjoy the fun.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 2, 2013
												I am Kiera563 of Alexina, and I endorse this game!I love Mabinogi: it's a fun MMO that has kept my attention for years.  This is no small feat, because I have major attention deficit and MMOs generally do not hold my attention long.You explore the land of Erinn as one of three races: Humans, Elves, or Giants (and yes, Giants really are more than twice the other races' sizes).  What is unique about this game is the leveling, aging and rebirth system: your character can be from 10 to 17 years of age to start with, and every week, he or she will grow age a year.  This provides a small boost in stats, but more importantly, once you reach Age 20, you can Rebirth.  Rebirthing allows you to reset your level to level 1, and your age to 10-17.  Sounds pointless, right?  Well, though you lose the stats you got from leveling, each level-up earns you 1 AP (ability point), and you keep all AP and skill ranks when you rebirth.AP is used to rank up Skills, whether they be combat skills like Combat Mastery, Ranged Attack, or Defense (to name a few of many), life skills like blacksmithing and tailoring, magic skills like Icebolt and Healing, or any of the many other types of skills: the highly-defensive Alchemy skills, the wide-area, dual-attacking Puppetry skills, the buff-providing Bard skills, the massively powerful single-target Fighter skills, and my personal favorite, the lightning-quick, highly offensive, wide-area Gunslinger skills.  A higher-ranked skill will be more effective, and will also permanently boost your stats.  This means a veteran player who is currently at level 1 but has rebirthed many times before could easily be stronger than a newbie who managed to reach level 50 for the first time.  So, the best way to size up somebody is their skill ranks and stats, not their level.  There are also extremely powerful Transformation skills, and they come in two flavors:  Race-specific and Demigod.Race-specific transformations provide an impressive buff to all stats as well as resistance to certain forms of damage, and most allow you to use a unique skill.  Demigod provides regeneration, increased movement speed, and the ability to fire off some of the most powerful attacks in the game.  They're really cool looking, and once you get them, you have a couple highly effective trump cards up your sleeve to pull out for boss fights.  If you're really desperate and/or going for overkill, you can use both at once!Another unique aspect of Mabinogi is the ability to play music.  You program a song onto an item called a Score Scroll (or copy paste it from the Internet...), and equip the scroll with an instrument, and voila, you can play MIDI-like tunes to your heart's content.  (Until the scroll breaks, that is, but you can always make another.)  Yes, hearing those tunes from your favorite games, like Mario and Zelda, echoing from the town square is really cool.This game has a massive amount of content, so if you're just starting to play, you definitely won't get bored, especially if you play with friends.  Mabi is a highly social MMO, and is at its best if you are screwing around with your buddies.  Of course, there's plenty of room for serious play, because the enemies can get brutal in dungeons like Peaca.  Mabinogi used to be much harder than it is now, but its original difficulty still shows at times, especially in early dungeons and story quests at low levels.  But it's never unfair, and having a full party of friends is always enough to even the odds.  *fondly remembers newbie bum rushes of Rabbie*Mabinogi does have its flaws, and Nexon, its developer/publisher, has dropped the ball many times before.  (Nexon is legendary for its screwups, though in recent times, they seem to be doing a lot better.)However, I highly recommend this game if you're looking to get into a new MMO.  And I'd be more than happy to show you the ropes if you add Kiera563 on Alexina.

If you do end up trying Mabinogi I would suggest avoiding a lot of the community as they are pretty toxic/dangerous people nowadays. I don't think I would recommend the game unless you're interested in the crafting and social aspect as there are many MMOs that will fufill your needs for anything else a lot better. I recommend FFXIV if you're looking for an anime-esque MMO with good customization and solid combat. ~~~~Old Review:I joined the game originally as a closed beta tester, there was almost nothing to do, but the interesting combat/skill system caught my attention and I continued to play the game. Since then they've added a ton of free content- such as singing, piano playing, dual gunning, farming, commerce, shadow-missions, etc.  There's weeks worth, if not more, of storyline content to play and they're still adding more. The leveling system makes it so you can always play any 'class' you want and have any and all skills or equipment you desire. You do have to rebirth once in a while to reset your level and get the ability points required to level skills efficiently, but fortunately it was made far easier when they somewhat recently added a conveniently free rebirth every time you hit age 21 in-game, which takes 3 real-life weeks after a rebirth to the maximum age. There is also quite a bit to choose from in ways of character customization, and if you don't fancy the anime style there are a few more neutral choices, as well as different races to choose from. You can also edit your characters height, and gain or lose weight and muscles depending on what you eat. There are also tons of clothing and armors to choose from, as well as dyes- although some colors are somewhat difficult to achieve, but there are always fixed-color dyes available from rebirth, gachapons, and other players.  They're currently giving out a free Holiday pet, along with the two free mounts you get for joining the game. Unfortunately a lot of the older pets have been retired and may or may not be re-released, but there are still a decent amount currently available. There's still a lot more to experience in the game, but you should try out the rest for yourself. If you ever need more information about the game you can always go to the mabinogiworld wiki, which although fan-made is pretty in-depth, active, and well-written. All things considered, I do recommend the game despite it's flaws and old age. It's definitely a unique experience and still pretty fun if you can get into it.

												Let's make this review short and sweet. Amazing game with an engaging story (until after generation 12) and fun PVE. PVP is just as fun. The amount of weapons and skills to vary from and quests to do, give a player TONS to do, next to the MASSIVE world made (which no one travels). Cons? The economy as a whole. Items that're COSMETIC, cost MORE than items that actually are used for combat, so when you try to sell over powered combat items, you won't truly get your monies worth. If you want to play this game, either have a group of friends that already play it a fair amount, or play with friends whom haven't played. Either way, this game isn't all that bad, but should be avoided if you aren't enticed my a rather one sided economy.

content:
Posted: August 18, 2014
												Let's give this another shot without the pointless tangent:This is a Korean MMORPG and everything that might lead you to suspect, by which I mainly mean that sometimes the whole code feels like a house of cards ready to blow up in a storm of bugs and embarassment at seemingly any or no provocation. This is compounded by a proneness to serious lag, which loves to pop up in the middle of combat just to murder your face for trying. Many-to-most features of the game are quite opaque and tricky to understand, and there's a lot of grindy crap. But, uh... Well, I enjoy it. It gets easier to enjoy as you get used to its flaws, I think.The combat would actually be quite fun if only it were less laggy and buggy, as it does at least have a nice weight to it. And then, if you'd rather not fight so much, well, there's just so much to friggin' do in this game. Go into one of many schools of combat if you want, or choose a more peaceful lifestyle of commerce or production, bearing in mind that you'll almost certainly want to be able to hold up in a fight whatever you do. It's a big and engaging world that's fun to just hang around in. The playerbase is... hmm. Well, it's... you can find some good folks, but I'm just glad it's easy to blacklist people. If you end up paying for anything, it will probably be pets, which can serve all kinds of useful functions to include simple combat backup and extra inventory space. You'll want inventory space.Anyway the point is, this is the sort of game where you can lose yourself for a long time if you're not careful. I seem to get a little more lost every time I come back to it. Honestly I'm okay with it. It's impressively far from perfect, but ultimately a good time.

content:
Posted: June 26, 2016
												I have been playing this game, on and off Steam, for almost a decade. I go through phases on the game where I may just log on for socializing and fashion or for the music skills and such; yet sometimes I am a hardcore dungeon crawler. (Shadow Missions are more fun in my opinion, just saying.) The devs put on great events with good timing between. The summer events are always the best, of course. It can seem like a free2play/pay2win type game when first starting out. And yes, there are many helpful items, as well as frivolous ones, that can be purchased with real-life money; however, as I discovered myself, it is not necessary if the player is dedicated and patient. The devs give plenty of opportunities to gain great items in game as well. I could continue listing lots of positives, but I need to get back to my chores. So...As for the negatives: Really only two things that I am constantly annoyed with enough to  mention them. One is the fact that, being an mmorpg, I must find a way to (virtually) co-exist with players from lands near and far. Which means dealing with a wide variety of personalities, morals, and norms. (Kinda like middle school or high school). As far as game play is concerned, I am constantly grumbling about awkward camera angles in some areas of the maps. But that is not a dealbreaker in any way. :D

content:
Posted: November 15, 2015
												(Don't let the Steam playtime fool you)What's there to say about Mabinogi...Well, to be honest, there's a lot to say about it. I first started playing Mabinogi around it's beta and continued to play it until G18-G19. Off and on. The game's story is split into mainstream questlines called Generations. Currently the game is still in G19. These Generation quests can take quite some time to complete, especially if you're new to the game so it would be best to either find some friends to play the game with, or make some friends in the game to play it with you.Most of these story/generation quests are actually based off of mythological lore from around the world, especially as of late. I won't go into detail about the story because I'm not one for spoilers, but I would recommend giving the game a try and run through a few to get the idea of it. Or just watch some videos/read the wiki.Skills:The skills in Mabinogi are pretty expansive, if not repetitive. In order to rank up your skills you have to continuously use them. Which isn't to say that's a bad thing. The one problem with it is that it's essentially playing a large and expanded version of Rock Paper Scissors with your enemies, especially in PVP. If you like Rock Paper Scissors, then this will be the combat system you've always been waiting for. The best way to explain the skills in terms of how they rank up is that you start out with Novice Level and when you upgrade it, it goes to F rank. From F you can go all the way up to A. Then from there, you go to rank 9 then down to rank 1. Rank 1 being the highest and max rank that you can achieve for that skill. This can take a very long time for certain skills and most of the time you'll find yourself AFK'ing or sleeping while doing the ones that can be set to auto-use. In order to rank these skills up however, you'll need AP, which there are various ways to obtain it, the main way is to level up.The thing I like the most about the game is that you can mix and match or get all the skills in the game with a single character. Of course, this will absorb a lot of your time in the process, but getting all the skills makes you feel like you've achieved something. Which is true because they're not all easy to get (Mage Spells are a pain, but oh so powerful).LevelingIf there's one thing that's great about mabinogi, it's that there's no level cap, and with that comes rebirthing. You can spend an eternity trying to get to lvl 200, or you can rebirth every other week once your character reaches the age of 20. (It's best to have your character at age 18 when you rebirth so that you can rebirth sooner without having to pay for a character card, I'll go into detail about that and other cash shop items in a bit) Each time you level, you get a random amount of AP, It's best to use this AP when you can, but be mindful about what you put it into. As certain skills when ranked up, will make it harder for you to gain EXP as you'll have to defeat more powerful monsters in order to get the EXP you're looking for (Looking at you Combat mastery!) If you're looking for a challenge from the game, that would definitely be the way to go.Cash Shop and Customer SupportNexon is notorious for it's cash shop in every game that they develop. and their customer support isn't exactly top notch in the game industry. This game is PAY TO WIN as much as I hate to admit it, but it always has been since G2 (You used to have to pay for VIP in order to use the now-free Paladin Transformation skill which is very powerful).When I say their Cash Shop is pay to win, I mean it in the terms of you can get the most powerful items in the game from the Gacha, and pets are the most powerful companions you can have. Most pets don't do much else other than give you more inventory space, but the rest have powerful AOE skills that can wipe dungeons and bosses in the early to most late game areas, not including end-game or fieldbosses.In terms of armor and weapons... well let's just say that in-game currency will not do you any favors in attempting to get them off of players, and the best but most efficient way of emptying your wallet is to just go through dozens of gacha boxes in an attempt to (possibly) get what you've been looking for. In the end, your inventory will be filled with either potions, or enchantment scrolls that usually suck♥♥♥♥♥Now that's not to say that all items from the cash shop are pay to win, but more cosmetic. Which people will shove their entire bank account into the cash shop's throat for dyes and clothing for which they want to make their character look infinitely better than they would normally. Unfortunately, I was one of these people who got sucked into what is known as....Fashionogi. Don't do cash shop kids, it will end you.Another thing you can buy from the Cash Shop are Nao stones, which you can also get daily from their VIP service. Nao stones will be your lord and savior in the middle of a hard dungeon, or after being cheap shotted by a boss. Most players won't be carrying around phoenix feathers, and in the end you'll have to PM your friends for a friendly yet unlikely revival stone that they can only get through Premium, or Gacha boxes.Now in terms of support....Support isnt Nexon's forte, let's just say. I haven't had many problems with them, but I know plenty of other players who have. Accounts being suspended, characters in their account being banned and unplayable, rendering their character slot useless, and the retrieval of items lost through being hacked is just the tip of it. You won't be getting those items back no matter how hard you beg, so don't try it. Scammers now litter Mabinogi and you have to be on top of your game in order to not lose to them, most of them aren't the best at what they do but just keep in mind, they will try to get that item you just won in Gacha. They'll find a wayMiscNow a lot of people might try to argue that mabinogi tries to even out its pay to win with free events that go on, which isnt entirely true, nor entirely false. The events are the funnest part about mabinogi aside from its expansive skill list (List, not tree). Or at least, they can be. They're usually the time of which the most players actually get on to mabinogi. However, more and more players are quitting Mabi and the amount of people playing is beginning to decline, with an exceptional few that join every other day because of Mabi now being on steam.The VerdictMabinogi is a fun game, one that I continuously go back to every now and again to play so that I can socialize or get some of the new items to make my character look good or to fiddle around with the combat system as new skills come out. Despite it's pay to win nature, there are other ways to get the items that you want. In game currency and trading (commerce skill is your saint here bring friends) is the best way to get the items that you desire. I would say that it's not worth playing in the long run, but you will make plenty of friends within the game that can last a long time.Personally, I'd give the game a 8/10.TL;DRMabinogi is good, sometimes♥♥♥♥♥♥ NoMaybeRecommendationOption/10

content:
Posted: November 12, 2013
												The game plays a lot like Ragnarok Online, which plays a lot like Diablo, which plays a lot like a number of old SSI computer games. Move the mouse, click the enemy, kick its♥♥♥♥♥ and repeat until you die of old age or kill yourself.You can go fishing to raise your dexterity, but it takes about 9,000 years before you can go up a rank in it. The game revolves around training your skills, then spending AP to raise them. The more you do it, the harder and harder (Read: More money you spend) it gets to actually raise it, and it will cost moar AP.With a name like Fantasy Life going for it, you can bet that people do treat it like it is their only life. You can make an ugly female character and buy a maid outfit and learn how to cook and pretend you are an actual anime woman! You can buy an explorers outfit and grind exploration levels (Which reset every time you rebirth, meaning you have to keep doing boring quests over and over again)It's full of incredible amounts of busy-work that you just don't want to do. If you're not leveling, you're probably grinding for materials that go for absurd amounts on the in-game market. NPCs don't give you squat if you sell anything to them, so don't bother. But the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s will turn around and overprice certain items regardless. If not that, you're probably trying to gain proficiency on your weapon. You don't just go to a blacksmith and tell someone to upgrade your weapon, it doesn't work like that. You have to beat up enemies with it and get points on the weapon, THEN you can upgrade it. It costs tons of gold and tons of points just to get one upgrade too, and if you don't do it you will insta-fail.Not only that, you have to worry about the repairing of these said weapons. If you want to try and keep your weapons in tip top shape, you have to shell out so much cash you'll probably end up buying some gold from Chinese Gold Farmers to make ends meet. All blacksmiths except one have a repair rate of 96% or lower. The one with 98% charges unbelievable rates for just one point of repair, the kind of rates that would make even Bill Gates think twice.The monotony doesn't end there. Not only does it take a few years of dedicated game play and credit card swiping to get anywhere in this game, you also have to worry about a broken e-Conomy that overprices ugly clothes that were released on old events because the ♥♥♥♥♥♥s think it's "retro". There are even dyes that have flashing properties, when applied to clothes they flash between colors and give epileptics one hell of a seizure and hurt the eyes of those healthy. People literally ♥♥♥♥♥ out for these in order to act cool among the other trash that plays this game. It's all about getting the prettiest clothes made for youtl;dr, this game is boring.

content:
Posted: February 19
												Dear god, where to begin with this crap fest of a game. First off, it's extremely heavy on your computer. Nexon could have fixed this years ago but they've been busy adding too much new stuff that costs either actual money or about 20m ig gold. I've only played for about two years, but I finally quit a couple days ago. The GMs are very biased and show favoritism towards friends; there's even rumors of the CM giving the rarest sword in the game to a friend of a friend for free. The storyline is decent, g19/g20 were my favorites, but hardly anyone actually plays the game. The game is almost completely dead, and those who still play (at least in Tarlach) just afk all day selling things from gacha for insane prices. Again, only playing on Tarlach, I might be biased, but the community is terrible. There's so much drama between guilds or just a couple people. Half the people, when they actually aren't afk, are total jerks. The other half are cancerous as h e l l. I will admit I've made several of friends on it, I wouldn't even be dating my boyfriend if I hadn't played it, but it's getting worse and worse every month. Save your computer, save your time, save your money, and don't play this game.

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 7, 2015
												What can I say about this game? It's repetitive, boring, ugly, has a terrible community, and makes you feel like you're in purgatory. It's managed by Nexon, one of if not the absolute worst MMO conglomerates in the business. It's a time sink that leaves you sitting in town squares rather than fighting because fighting for more than an hour or two is an Olympic test of patience and fortitude. I have many hours on Steam, but I barely play it anymore. Before the Steam release, I sank 20,000-30,000 hours and upward of $300 in rebirths into a character, which got deleted by a hacker while I was taking a long break from the game. Did Nexon compensate me? No. Did they have so much as the decency to respond to my ticket? No. Seriously, why are you even looking at this game? Go play something good. Unfortunately I'm cursed by a history with this game, so I've yet to be able to fully shake it. People keep drawing me back in. Now I get why people keep playing♥♥♥♥♥♥like Runescape. Just get away while you can. I could've done so much more in life with the time I wasted on this unfulfilling, ♥♥♥♥♥♥ game.

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 5, 2013
												Pros-Unique Gameplay-Nonlinear Progression-Many different ways to spend one's time in game-Average communityCons-Nexon-Servers tend to be unstable at times. Makes certian skills & skill sets non-viable.-PVP is fun, but has to be balanced by player-made rules. -Many quests & events are incredibly vague. You must use the wiki for this game.-Mainstream quest lines & lore are confusing as heck. -Nexon continues to release more powerful cash shop itmes. You will likely spend at least the same amount of money you would on a subscription-based on them. If you're not a careful spender, possibly more.  -Client-sided lag even on the strongest of machines. Variable (Depends on your personal tastes)-Cell shaded anime-style graphics.-Soundtrack -Nearly infinite progression (Been playing for almost three years and I'm still nowhere near what I want.)-Hilarious additions to the game that make no sense (Lightsabers, Guns, & Scooters in a medival fantasy-style world.)One thing to note is that this game will probably ruin you for other MMOs, if you play it for too long. Point & Click will feel too dull, and anything strictly action based will feel awkward. I really wish there were more games like this, because Nexon & devCat don't seem to know how the heck to balance it.

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 3, 2016
												Let me start off by saying I love the anime art-style of this MMORPG, it's adorable. :D Pros:• Cute art style (as mentioned already xD)• Friendly community - I've never met anyone in it that was rude or anything :)• Being able to play musical instruments like the lute, harp, etc. and fight with them :D• Flying mounts \o/• Taming animals• Nice soundtrack ^o^Cons:• Feels a little loney now, like it's community is slowly disappearing or something. :(• You have to spend money to really enjoy the game, otherwise there's very little character customization and pets. They also kind of shove their item mall in your face constantly and it gets annoying x.x• Combat is a bit strange, I don't know what it is about the animations or something but I just don't like it. o.x• As much as I love this game, I played it for a couple months and got bored with it, I rarely pick it up again nowadays. :/ There's just not a lot to do on it anymore, for me anyway. :C This game is a great time killer if you want to distract yourself for a couple weeks or so, but not really a long-term kind of game. u:

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 24, 2014
												This game brings faith back to the Anime MMO genre. Usually you find games that play themselves by you just clicking a quest (*cough* aura kingdom *cough*) or Anime MMOs that have you picking one class and the skill/armors/weapons are extremely linear (*cough* Luna Online *cough*), However, this one throws all of those out the window. No equipment is "unequippable" save for a few that require tons of training. None are just "better" than the others. The combat system is incredibly well-paced, and even if you chose to be one talent (class), it doesn't stop you from training/having skills from another talent, and that's really what takes the cake for me. As someone who's played for 4 years (without steam, of course), I can say that I'm still finding more and more things all the time and it's never a dull moment. And I will say; this game has the best composing system. If you're good enough, literally 'any' song IN THE WORLD can be in the game. It just takes a bit of work, but so worth it to me, and a huge veriety of intruments to work with too. A definite pick up for those interested in Anime MMOs, but can't find one that's not ♥♥♥♥♥♥.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 19, 2014
												One of my favorite MMORPG's. I would have to say I put a lot of hours into this game, just because there's so much to do. In the beginning, you can choose one of the many set classes in the game, which will end up being your main skill. But that isn't all you can do. Mabinogi doesn't just limit you to what kind of class you picked, and you can learn to be...let's say a martial artist, or  musician if you wanted to. It has a great combat system, because you have to plan what kind of attacks to use to counter your enemies. The feel of the game itself is very relaxing, and free. I would definately recommend this game to people who are into fantasy, and who need a game that has more of a free-roam feeling.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 7, 2016
												Pros: Customization is very good, it lives up to its free-to-play titleCons: Music is agonizing. Combat is horrible, Characters are just boring. Game is boring. Servers are♥♥♥♥♥ It took me ten minutes to figure out where the hell the menu and options were because it's so damn hard to see. Most things about this game is boring. the game itself starts out loud as hell (and the menu and options problem doesn't help). The UI is cluttered with so much ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t in the beggining it's hard to figure out what the hell is going on.Notable information: The soundtrack (as I said before) is agonizingly bad; it's best to just mute it and play your own music. The customization options are actually so good, I'd like to see more games with that kind of variety. Progression is really easy. Combat is a mess of clicking and hoping something happens. The game looks like♥♥♥♥♥♥even on the highest graphic settings, but I'll give that a pass since the game is pretty old. Nothing really makes sense in the game when you first start it, it'll throw you in and it may take you an hour or two (that I didn't bother to spend) to figure out what the ♥♥♥♥ is happening. You won't enjoy this game unless you're the following: Easy to impress, a small child, never played any MMORPG before in your entire life, a diehard fan of this game, very very intoxicated.Conclusion: This game is garbage, not complete garbage, but pretty bad. I would not reccomend this game to anyone (unless they're what I said before). There's a reason I don't have a lot of time on record with this game, which I've played before it came to Steam. All in all, you can try it, it's free, but don't put money into it; it's not even worth it.

content:
Posted: January 6, 2013
												Mabinogi is one of my all-time favorite MMORPGs. If you spent countless hours playing RuneScape or Harvest Moon back in the day, you'll probably like this too.Grinding by endlessly fighting monsters isn't necessary in this game, though the dungeons and fields offer the opportunity. Instead, much of your experience will come from quests and skill building. Part-time jobs offered by the shopkeepers of Erinn are a helpful way to gain exp, gold, and crafting supplies. Each character in this world is unique, so doing quests is a good way to build friendships. There is a huge selection of skills, and you are free to build as many as you like. This includes, but is not limited to, fishing, cooking, tailoring, carpentry, metalworking, transformation, alchemy, music playing, swordfighting, archery, and magic. Practicing your trade(s) contributes to your skill level and your overall level. This allows you to use new techniques and recipes.Your character ages at the rate of 1 year for every 1 real-life week. If your level and age get too high for your taste, you can be reborn as your younger self (or a completely new person with a purchasable character card). You keep your skills and items, but resetting your level allows you to try new quests and gain AP faster to promote skill growth. Your character grows and changes weight as you get older and vary your diet and activity, making rebirth all the more refreshing.Overall, Mabinogi is a great MMO because it offers enough variety to last for countless hours of playtime. Even if the cutesy anime style graphics aren't to your taste, Mabinogi is worth a try if you long for a quality crafting/exploration MMO.

Posted: March 5, 2015
												Overall the game can be fun. but has certain flaws. such flaws would be not having the ability to fully use WASD keys to move in fear of getting stuck it's a bit out dated but it's still one of the fun rpg's out there, the community is good, but it can also be bad depending on where you look and your personality. there are very few bugs but they still exist but don't bother me none, however if you don't have "slutwear" you are nothing. at least that's how a majority of the players will see you as. i like the story and i happen to like a lot of the fighting styles and skills. i have spent 5 years of my life and probably in the amount of $5k in NX, i personally hate micro-transactions but for mabi, i can live with it. based on this alone, i will give it a  7/10, now to anyone who actually decides to play the game and finds out about the Royal Alchemist and decide to want to pursue this path, DON'T. you will have to raises 28 alchemy skills to Rank 1 just to even remotely qualify to apply, and even then. training some of these skills will make you CONTEPLATE SUICIDE, i never had a game ever make me think suicide but RA grinding did that to me. RA Grind A/5, Mabi 9/10. COME PLAY, IT'S FUN (i'm not even kidding, i'm still playing right now as i write this review)

												Would I recommend this? Probably not.Overall I can say I found this game fun, and I have been playing since beta but how it has expanded over the years but how it has changed isn't pleasant. When you know people sitting at cumulative level of 10000+ and they just sit around afk all the time along with everyone else you realize how drained this game truly is. It's heading down hill, and they will continue to release a bunch of shop items to get you stronger faster. It's lost its spark for me, and even though I have likely put in at least 5000 hours into it I just can't log back in. It's rather bittersweet and kinda sad.I wouldn't recommend this.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 6, 2013
												Mabinogi is one of my all-time favorite MMORPGs. If you spent countless hours playing RuneScape or Harvest Moon back in the day, you'll probably like this too.Grinding by endlessly fighting monsters isn't necessary in this game, though the dungeons and fields offer the opportunity. Instead, much of your experience will come from quests and skill building. Part-time jobs offered by the shopkeepers of Erinn are a helpful way to gain exp, gold, and crafting supplies. Each character in this world is unique, so doing quests is a good way to build friendships. There is a huge selection of skills, and you are free to build as many as you like. This includes, but is not limited to, fishing, cooking, tailoring, carpentry, metalworking, transformation, alchemy, music playing, swordfighting, archery, and magic. Practicing your trade(s) contributes to your skill level and your overall level. This allows you to use new techniques and recipes.Your character ages at the rate of 1 year for every 1 real-life week. If your level and age get too high for your taste, you can be reborn as your younger self (or a completely new person with a purchasable character card). You keep your skills and items, but resetting your level allows you to try new quests and gain AP faster to promote skill growth. Your character grows and changes weight as you get older and vary your diet and activity, making rebirth all the more refreshing.Overall, Mabinogi is a great MMO because it offers enough variety to last for countless hours of playtime. Even if the cutesy anime style graphics aren't to your taste, Mabinogi is worth a try if you long for a quality crafting/exploration MMO.

												It's a lot more in-depth than most popular mmos, surprisingly. There is a lot to do usually, but it sort of forces you to play alone most of the time unless you're doing an event or sitting around in a town and playing your lute while you talk about things with friends.Really, the only way you can enjoy this game is if you are baked out of your mind or are 12 years old with an extremely long attention span. It's fun, though, and there is a lot of customization available. Your character path isn't extremely limited to one class or playstyle, so you can pretty much just wander around and do whatever.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 26, 2013
												Despite it's really outdated graphics, it remains my favourite MMORPGs of all time after over 5 years of playing. The seemingly endless amounts of content, good storyline, and attention to detail makes up for the lack of great graphics. There's also a good sense of a helpful community in the game that are often missing in MMOs that are lost in pure competitiveness. Mabinogi is one of the few MMOs that lets you take it easy when you feel like it; you aren't pressured to grind, you can focus on training more than one group of skills at a time, or just talk and have good times with friends.

content:
Posted: January 11, 2014
												Mabinogi was the second MMO I have ever played before -Years ago- And I have yet to find a reason not to stop playing it. The fact that you don't need to do the same thing over and over like other MMO's, you can do a lot of other things beside dungeons. You can farm, have a life style of a chef and be who you want to be in the game. I think everyone should give it a try before they find it 'boring'.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 12, 2014
												Mabinogi is definitely one of the most interesting kinds of MMORPG's I've ever played. It's packed with things to do both combat and non combat related. The community is great depending on what server you're on (I'd suggest Alexina if you're a beginner) and is truly one of Nexon's crown jewels in the F2P Market that holds up with new content even after 6 YEARS. The style is friendly, warm and inviting. The music is also calm and relaxing in my oppinion. The skills are a point and click with a skill hot bar system which may turn off some people if they're tired of that kinda thing like I was, but the combat animation looks so cool I barely cared at all plus some skills require you to press buttons like the martial artist talent which I found pretty sweet. However I must explain the cons, The game's Rebirth System maybe confusing to some people. Basically it's the system that replaces traditional "Level Up, Up a few of your skills". Mabinogi has a ranking system with each and every skill and you rank up these skills by spending a certain amount of "AP" which you get by Leveling Up and Doing quests that reward AP. So for those that feel at one point that they need to get more AP they're free to "Rebirth" which means resetting back to Level 1, BUT you keep all of your skill ranks so you're able to increase them further by leveling up. (NOTE: LEVEL UP YOUR WINDMILL SKILL FIRST, IT WILL BE MORE DIFFICULT TO LATER ON) Next on the Con List is the steam version..I've ran into so many problems with the steam version that I just up and decided to un-install everything and re-install it from the actual site. In fact you'll probably get the best performance from just installing it from the website. Last on the con list is Nexon, Now I do love some of their games but I dislike their company mainly for my poor experience in Customer Support. I don't know about you but I expect AT LEAST average to good customer support whenever my money is being put into a company (You can purchase additional content not required by the game in the Nexon Cash Shop for Character Customization, Different mounts, and Pets). Nexon's customer support is poor, so poor that it's almost insulting so buyer beware. So in short, I do recommend this game just not the Steam Version :/

content:
Posted: February 10, 2015
												It certainly sells itself well, with the cute outfits, and the promise of fun casual play as well as competitive battles. However, from the time it takes for you get to the character creation to the starting city, you're pretty much done with it. The controls are over-complicated, the interface and graphics are very poor quality, and the lack of a beginner guide that is worth a crap is sad. This is all-around pretty horrible, and even in the short time I tried it, already had bugs that have probably been pointed out to Nexon, but ignored all this time. Don't bother downloading it, guys and gals.

Probably not.Overall I can say I found this game fun, and I have been playing since beta but how it has expanded over the years but how it has changed isn't pleasant. When you know people sitting at cumulative level of 10000+ and they just sit around afk all the time along with everyone else you realize how drained this game truly is. It's heading down hill, and they will continue to release a bunch of shop items to get you stronger faster. It's lost its spark for me, and even though I have likely put in at least 5000 hours into it I just can't log back in. It's rather bittersweet and kinda sad.I wouldn't recommend this.

												Overall the game can be fun. but has certain flaws. such flaws would be not having the ability to fully use WASD keys to move in fear of getting stuck it's a bit out dated but it's still one of the fun rpg's out there, the community is good, but it can also be bad depending on where you look and your personality. there are very few bugs but they still exist but don't bother me none, however if you don't have "slutwear" you are nothing. at least that's how a majority of the players will see you as. i like the story and i happen to like a lot of the fighting styles and skills. i have spent 5 years of my life and probably in the amount of $5k in NX, i personally hate micro-transactions but for mabi, i can live with it. based on this alone, i will give it a  7/10, now to anyone who actually decides to play the game and finds out about the Royal Alchemist and decide to want to pursue this path, DON'T. you will have to raises 28 alchemy skills to Rank 1 just to even remotely qualify to apply, and even then. training some of these skills will make you CONTEPLATE SUICIDE, i never had a game ever make me think suicide but RA grinding did that to me. content:
Posted: January 19, 2015
												I cannot recommend this game enough. Its combat system is unique (in all 15+ forms it can take, per your choosing), Its world is massive, its art is bright and colorful, its stories are deep and dark (in stark contrast to the art, no less!), every non-event update does its best to appeal to both new and veteran players, with the majority of event updates doing the same (some events will appeal more to new players and others to veterans), and recent updates over the past year or so have been made to alleviate some of the major complaints of the community (travel was once facilitated with teleportation gates that were only open during in-game day or night and were sparsely placed; now they have added a vast number more and all gates are constantly open once you use them for the first time).The major downfall of this game is that it's hard to find a community. The game in no way facilitates party-finding or guild-hunting and it's up to you to find a guild that actually works for your playstyle or people who want to party up for your shenanigans. In short: best to bring 1-7 friends to play with.That said, it's very easy to play through the game mostly solo, and most of my hours are doing just that. It's fun and engaging.P.S. If you're musically inclined, give the base musical skills (play instrument, composing, musical knowledge) a go. Performing something in town is a very easy way to gather attention and make a friend or two.

content:
Posted: February 12, 2016
												For what it is worth, Mabinogi is one of those MMORPGs that will have you glued to your computers for hours if you get passed the initial obstacle course of a learning curve. However It is a great game none the less. Lots to do, decent community if you ignore the bad mouths out there, LOTS of customization, few to no restrictions on the skill trees. Downside to this game is that it has a great lot of potential that has gone to waste, and that is what drove me away in the end. Don't get me wrong, it is probably one of the better mmorpgs out there, but I have spent 7 years on this game and I feel I have had my fair share of fun with Mabinogi and it's time for me to move on.Either way give it a try. If you like then you like it. If you don't you don't. It's that simple.7 raging golems out of 10. the developers need to focus on the game content and not so much on the premium items. This game has a lot of potential Nexon, and you're letting it slip!

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 23, 2016
												This game has changed a lot over the years. It used to be a quaint little game based on Celtic mythology. Now it is an anime based game with everything from dragons to scooters to food trucks. Mabinogi is a great sandbox game if you want to just explore the world, have the freedom to level up any skills you want (unrestricted by a class system) or meet people and be social. The world is bright and cheerful, with a darker main storyline to quest through if you want some direction in the mostly sandbox game. Unfortunately, the game is VERY heavily pay to win. If you want to have good gear, good stats, and be able to participate in high end content, you will have to buy items in the cash shop to increase your character's power. The worst part about this is that the items (gachapon, reforges, etc) are completely RNG based. So you might have to buy just a few to get what you want, or you might spend hundreds of dollars and still not get what you want. Also sold in the cash shop are numerous pets, which help quite a lot in combat. Each of these pets runs about $15, so it can get expesive quite fast. Finally, there are many, many types of boosters that are sold in the cash shop, to help you raise your skills faster and level up faster. These are less of a problem, because it's just a time vs money thing, but it is still the icing on the cake to make this game pay to win.Because of the numerous pay to win elements, I cannot recommend this game, as charming and friendly as it is. If Nexon would just restrict the cash shop items to cosmetics and maybe a few boosters, I would recommend this game in a heartbeat.

content:
Posted: December 19, 2013
												Its the MMORPG that has had me the most entertained and has very unique features, the game sure has quite changed over the 4 years I played it, but its still great, sadly i wish some of its issues and glitches were to be adressed, lag also plays a large problem, but overall, I love the game. Its very social, and its combat system is rather stragetical, but it can even be played to the point its like an action game!, despite of how outdated and glitchy, and all of its other problems it contains, I have yet to see another game to have some of the unique features this one has, its already a decade old as well and its pretty innovative till today.So far, no other mmorpg managed to steal me from this one, as for now, its the best mmorpg out there for me.For 4 yearsEDIT---Its been quite a while since I wrote this review, but im here to update, this game is going to an awful direction, the optimization is getting worse, old content is getting ignored, the game is heavily unbalanced to the point that theres no difficulty, enemies are either too easy, or too cheap, I loved this game a lot and enjoyed it a lot, but then the game just took a bad turn and it seems like it wont turn back from that.The game seems to be far beyond recovery to what is actually fun about it, theres many outdated things about it that devs wont bother to touch to keep the game consistent and up-to-date, and no, im not talking about graphics or any of the new-tech sort of the thing, im talking about how several parts of the game havent been touched for years while more and more content is being added but doesnt mix well with the rest of the game. Its only getting worse in terms of whats balanced, even the story was screwed with so much that none of it makes sense anymore, I wouldnt bother recommending this game to anyone anymore, all what I see left of it is a bunch of people wanting to look pretty in it.

content:
Posted: August 16, 2014
												This game is perhaps one of the strangest, most beautiful games that I have ever had the pleasure to play.I've had maybe 500 hours offline, and I'm still not even close to getting to the end of the game. Why not? Because you can have millions hours of this game, and you'll never finish. This isn't a game that's focused on fighting- it's shaped around social interactions. I've spent hours just sitting in a square, talking to friends and listening to people play music. This is a game that you'll go to find friends in, to relax and talk in, not fight endlessly in.

												Its the MMORPG that has had me the most entertained and has very unique features, the game sure has quite changed over the 4 years I played it, but its still great, sadly i wish some of its issues and glitches were to be adressed, lag also plays a large problem, but overall, I love the game. Its very social, and its combat system is rather stragetical, but it can even be played to the point its like an action game!, despite of how outdated and glitchy, and all of its other problems it contains, I have yet to see another game to have some of the unique features this one has, its already a decade old as well and its pretty innovative till today.So far, no other mmorpg managed to steal me from this one, as for now, its the best mmorpg out there for me.For 4 yearsEDIT---Its been quite a while since I wrote this review, but im here to update, this game is going to an awful direction, the optimization is getting worse, old content is getting ignored, the game is heavily unbalanced to the point that theres no difficulty, enemies are either too easy, or too cheap, I loved this game a lot and enjoyed it a lot, but then the game just took a bad turn and it seems like it wont turn back from that.The game seems to be far beyond recovery to what is actually fun about it, theres many outdated things about it that devs wont bother to touch to keep the game consistent and up-to-date, and no, im not talking about graphics or any of the new-tech sort of the thing, im talking about how several parts of the game havent been touched for years while more and more content is being added but doesnt mix well with the rest of the game. Its only getting worse in terms of whats balanced, even the story was screwed with so much that none of it makes sense anymore, I wouldnt bother recommending this game to anyone anymore, all what I see left of it is a bunch of people wanting to look pretty in it.

content:
Posted: November 23, 2016
												This game has changed a lot over the years. It used to be a quaint little game based on Celtic mythology. Now it is an anime based game with everything from dragons to scooters to food trucks. Mabinogi is a great sandbox game if you want to just explore the world, have the freedom to level up any skills you want (unrestricted by a class system) or meet people and be social. The world is bright and cheerful, with a darker main storyline to quest through if you want some direction in the mostly sandbox game. Unfortunately, the game is VERY heavily pay to win. If you want to have good gear, good stats, and be able to participate in high end content, you will have to buy items in the cash shop to increase your character's power. The worst part about this is that the items (gachapon, reforges, etc) are completely RNG based. So you might have to buy just a few to get what you want, or you might spend hundreds of dollars and still not get what you want. Also sold in the cash shop are numerous pets, which help quite a lot in combat. Each of these pets runs about $15, so it can get expesive quite fast. Finally, there are many, many types of boosters that are sold in the cash shop, to help you raise your skills faster and level up faster. These are less of a problem, because it's just a time vs money thing, but it is still the icing on the cake to make this game pay to win.Because of the numerous pay to win elements, I cannot recommend this game, as charming and friendly as it is. If Nexon would just restrict the cash shop items to cosmetics and maybe a few boosters, I would recommend this game in a heartbeat.

number of helpful: 39 of 80 people (49%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 25, 2014
												I used to like this game, and I occasionally spent a little money on it. It's one of those games where you have to put in a lot of time to get in any results, but I didn't mind. I had a lot of time to kill. As time passed, it became increasingly clear that this was a pay-to-win, even moreso than in the past. The price of pets was rising to over twenty dollars. That was alright, I could still play. It wasn't as much fun, but I still had the friends I made in the universe of Mabi.After a while, I started to have trouble launching the game - sometimes it would crash after a few minutes. Not long after, it started to do that every time I tried to play. I tried reinstalling it; at this point it quit launching altogether. I submitted a ticket to nexon, which was automatically canceled since it fell under Tech support; the automated message told me to post in the Tech support forums. I was a little irritated, but I did anyways. I had sunk a lot of time into this, so I didn't want to give up so easily. I didn't get any help, just a few useless comments and one or two people saying they had the same problem.I found the game was on steam, and all was well for a time. However, when I helped my Guild mine stones for a castle we'd won in an Auction (it would only be ours temporarily) and we completed it, I found that I needed Premium service to actually enter the dang place. I was less than pleased. I still played a little, just dinking around and talking to my friends now and then, working an undeveloped character I happened to have when I had some time to kill. (I avoided playing it unless I KNEW I had a lot of time; many of the quests require a maddening amount of running back and forth to two NPC's who were often on different ends of the continent, or at least a few cities apart. This game is impossible unless you drop some cash on pets to get around without going insane. Even then, travel takes longer than is fair, and with the increasing size of cities, much of which are empty and with a handful of NPC's spread over something that can take half an hour or more to traverse on foot...) Then, after a while, it started crashing after a few minutes again. At this point, I begrudingly cut my losses, deciding that it wasn't worth the effort and the frustration I was getting from the worsening pay-to-win environment and rising costs.

content:
Posted: October 1, 2014
												With my previous experience with this game (and my current play after recent updates), it is hard to say whether or not I actually enjoyed it. What I liked was the customisability and open world feel to the game, with many different play options to explore. However, after my terrible experience with paywalls a few years ago, I subsequently quit playing. Downloading it again to see what improvements had been made.PROS- The game is up to you how to play and explore.- There are many different ways to customise your character.- A devoted fanbase.- Opportunity to waste many hours.CONS- Compatibility and anti-aliasing issues.- It's an old game, so some textures look very low-res, whilst newer items/areas look far more detailed, which breaks the flow of the game, in my opinion.- While the fanbase is devoted, the player base is much smaller than it was, leading to the world feeling barren and empty.- The combat system takes a lot of getting used to, and often made me want to flip the table.- Some story aspects seem forced to add content (race war, really?)- Pop up windows, annoying and always at the worst times.Overall, if you're new, you're a bit late to the party. Has Nexon quality (generally p2p and such). But if you can cope with the cons and somewhat annoying pop up windows, and playing mostly alone, then go for it![this review is my experience and opinion, debate it any way you see fit :)]

content:
Posted: March 7, 2013
												Unlike other Asian MMOs where it is filled with fanbase of big boobs, panty shots, etc. for the male/lesbian taste, and mainly focused on combat. This is a fun MMORPG to try out for at least 3 days (or your money back).When you first start, you may feel overwhelmed and excited to try out as many skills as you can. It is highly recommended that you try out each skill at least a few times before leveling it from Novic to F (if it requires 0 AP then go ahead) because you will not get those back. Eventually you'll figure out which talent you want to invest in, take your time on that.One thing I really like is that the clothing/equipment doesn’t always look the same in color and may not have the same stats either, if created by tailoring and/or blacksmithing, same for some weapons. This game really focuses on teamwork and is very welcoming to casual players as well. Another thing I really enjoy the most is how some of the NPC's break the 4th wall at times, or that some of the enemy's you meet will wear funny disguises. Lastely, weapons and equipment are sort of irrelevant in damage and defense. Talents are what really helps you grow whether be combat or non-combat talents. Level, Age, and Race also play as a factor for stat increase. Can also earn money not only by questing or grinding, but by part-time jobs or commerce as well! If you play your cards right, you could earn 10k+ in no time!There are a few flaws/annoyances though: Can only make one character (Only bright side is that with your first character you can pick all the choices, normal and premium, for customizing, however will have to purchase another character card via cash shop, depending on type price varies, or make an alliance with either Elves or Giants to get a free card of that race). There is no advance warning that you’re using a beginner inventory package till level 30, where you’re able to use the full bank inventory, but the right half will be locked after level 30 and anything stored in there will be stuck unless you get the Inventory Plus Service from the Cash Shop for $8 for 30 days. The inventory on your character may get easily filled if you’re taking on too many talents. When buying a pattern or a blueprint for crafting clothe, weapon, armor, you don’t know what materials will be needed till after you purchase and start to use it. Best to use the wiki for this, it’ll save you up on gold.Recommend doing 2-3 life skill talents that require frequent inventory space like Tailoring, Medicine, and Cooking. It is nice to have at least one combat talent too like Close Combat (aka Warrior), Lance, Magic, etc. Say no more than two combat talents though if you wish to do any non-combat talents, and vise versa.On the server I go to, Alexina, the community is friendly and helpful to newbies (however there are exceptions.) I have rarely seen any players that gloat/brag/show off about their W/L record, about how strong they are, or about their equipment and skills. This makes the game fun and comfortable to play in. Overall, who needs skill when you can have fun? That’s what the game is really emphasizing, fun!The only piece of fanbase you’ll get the best of is at the start after making your first character. Enjoy the bouncy boobs while you can, because that’ll probably be the only time you’ll get to see anything jiggle on a woman!-----Check out more games I see that deserve more attention from my curator group:BluePaw's Underrated Games ListJoin and/or follow if you wish.

number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 7, 2015
												Let me get this straight off the bat: I love Mabinogi. Character customization skill-wise is my top priority when it comes to MMORPGs, but when you start shifting the focus towards vanity items that do absolutely nothing except for making your character look good and you add a crap ton of random classes that confuse the heck out of enemy AI who've only had to deal with melee, bows, and magic, that's when I start frowning on the game. Ignore the playtime Steam has. I've played for quite awhile on the standalone launcher. Anyway, back to the review. In a nutshell, Nexon has turned Mabinogi into a cash grab with no good updates in who knows how long just to satisfy their greed. Yes, I just called Nexon out for being greedy. Yes, I will continue to point out Nexon's flaws through out this review.| Gameplay |The original system for Mabi's combat was a modified rock-paper-scissors match which required skill more than luck. Smash broke through Block, Counter evaded Smash's slow attack, normal melee couldn't break Block, etcetera, but with the addition of new classes and skills along with it, the AI of the mobs just can't cope. They only know the bare essentials with maybe a special skill or two for the bosses.Outside of combat the economy of Mabi is jacked. You can hardly get started nowadays without buying something with real money from the Nexon store. Maybe, just maybe, if you find a experianced player then maybe they'll give you some gear, but with Mabi's playerbase dropping, it would be very rare.| Graphics |Perhaps the greatest point of Mabi is the graphics. But even then they look a tad outdated. Anime/Manga styled characters and mobs is the core concept of Mabi's graphics. Beutiful landscapes and sunsets, dark and grim dungeons, it is pretty cool, but still, it all could use a good polish.| Community |The second most important thing to me is the community of the game. Friendly players willing to help out the newbies, a good rivalry between guilds, the lightest touch of drama here and there... Mabi used to have all this, but with the player base dwindling, well, it's going to be hard to find a person and not a bot. And a reason behind it all is Nexon's inability to respond to support tickets.| Summary |Gameplay   - 3/10Graphics     - 8/10Community - 3/10Average - 4.5/10Mabi was fun. I loved this game entirely. Now it's just a shadow of a shell of its formor(reference) self.

content:
Posted: February 23, 2014
												Ground rules:Don't ever jump into this game without knowing anything. Don't recommend anything aside from a warrior talent for begginers. (Because no one gets other talent tutorials. You can always rebirth later anyway.)Try to figure out a skill build for your current talent.Experienced players are your best firends. (But don't make them your weapons.)Sometimes the wiki is necessary.Got it? Good.Ok, now this game is meant for all of you who are sick and tired of MMOs with the WoW style targeting based combat system. Level grinding also isn't that important. What is important is your skills. Skills make up your stats, what weapons you use, and how you fight. Combat isn't meant to be a stat battle either, (although it certainly can be at times). What is more important is if you know how to use your skills, weapons, and the enemy's AI to your advantage. Overall you have to learn a few things by yourself in this game and not give up if you want to get anywhere.

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 23, 2014
												Having suddenly been re-engulfed in this game to a greater extent than ever, I'll try to give better context to its staying power. Mabinogi is very rough around the edges, thanks in part to the localization being managed by Nexon of all things. It's over a decade old and much a product of its time, unoptimized, laggy, hard to get running on a modern OS, not very user friendly, the game does not explain itself well, you will constantly have to reference the wiki to make any headway in a number of things and understand the convoluted backend systems at work, Nexon support is nonexistent, and above all else the barrier to entry is horrible.The way character progression works is by leveling up to gain "AP", which you use to rank up your skills that not only improve the skills' functionality, but often grant incremental stat bonuses. Then when the level grind gets too slow, you rebirth and start over from level 1 to continue accumulating AP. The end result is that the game is tailored around accumulating ridiculously inflated stat bonuses from skill ranks, to the point that your character level means little to nothing. Unfortunately, early quests are not very well balanced and have about as much chance of being a cakewalk as stoving your face in in an instant, as you are extremely fragile to start.Where the game shines is in breadth of content. Combat is action-based and operates on a sort of rock-paper-scissors triangle that has since bloated outward but is still pretty interesting, on the rare occasion when it isn't being crippled by lag. Combat skill trees include swordplay, blunt weapons and axes, battle alchemy, magic, puppetry (yes, really), dual guns, one-on-one fisticuffs, archery, lancing, musical buffs and bludgeoning instruments, and for the hell of it, ninjas. Production skills include blacksmithing, fishing, cooking, mining, tailoring, herbalism, metallurgy, magic craft, engineering, carpentry, various alchemy, commerce, and for the hell of it, playing instruments via MML - the latter of which is what hooked my interest to begin with, actually.If you're wondering where the payment incentive comes in, the answers are: pets, extra storage, and crappy lottery gachapons. Your starting inventory is pretty pithy all things considered; pets (that come with storage), special events, and limited edition cash shop items are the best remedy to this. Pets have the added bonus of being cute, and a semicompetent combat companion (if you level them up before they age).So it's a bit hit and miss, but as a whole the game itself is a remarkable sight better than it once was, between all the retoolings and added content. It's still kind of a guilty pleasure, but a good romp with friends. If you ever play, be sure to set up on the Mari server. It's where all the cool guys are at.

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 23, 2014
												Personally, I do not like Mabinogi.  It has a lot of promise buried some where deep within it, but it never really appears.The story you experience in the game consistently has you helping NPCs you'd rather brutally murder.  And the quests tied to these stories have various levels of imbalance, either being way too easy for a long time, or way too cheap all of a sudden causing you to die like crazy.Although the game gives an impression that you can choose what skills you want to learn, what race you want to be, what equipment you want to wear, and what you want to do, you quickly learn that, in order to be good at the game, these choices quickly stop being choices.  Due to Combat Power requirements that only get worse as you level up and learn skills, you practically have to learn the skills in a set manner, with the most gruelling and reviled of these coming first simply because your lower Combat Power makes them "easier".  The races are imbalanced, with Elves being the butt monkeys of the game, Humans not really excelling at any one thing, and Giants being "teh best evarz".  Equipment is heavily restricted by Race and Gender, with the best either being horrendously ugly or costing an in-game fortune because they were once cash-shop items that you can no longer get.  And, as for doing what you want, you have the choice of pretending this is a fancy chatroom like Second Life or you have to do almost everything permanent, including the story, to become skilled at the game.Of course, this game also has problems with lag and latency.  Regardless of how fast your connection is or how good your computer is, you will find yourself getting cheaped on by enemies you should be owning because they have consistent 0 lag and erratic movement while the game's engine is struggling to display certain graphics or send commands at a reasonable rate.  This hinderance continues as you will also occasionally to frequently miss the timing on certain skills, such as the Chain 2 and 3 Fighter skills, because the server starts the timer on them before it even sends the data to your client and you have to go through as series of back-and-forth messages with the client and server to line whatever skill you are trying to do to whatever enemy you are trying to do it on.You might have better luck with the game than I did overall, but I'm just posting how I feel about the game.

												The combat side of this game has a learning curve, and will repeatedly put your tactical ability to the test.There is a limited character inventory, and you might find yourself buying additional character cards to cope with all the items you want to keep.Need a break from combat? Explore the life skills. Your effectiveness on the battlefield should benefit slightly.Dedicated role players are welcome to the game, too. There are groups within the overall game community who support role players new and experienced. Two of these groups can be found on the Tarlach server.

												This is a fun game. The combat is satisfying, the side quests are amusing, the story is pretty interesting, all in all, it's a pretty good game. It's a good one. But the fact that not everyone can continue progressing is a turn off to me.

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 5, 2015
												Played it from the standalone version when it came out a couple years ago, had a lot of fun. The players were progressing a bit faster than the updates were coming, but everyone was fine with it, we were patient because the game was so solid and entertaining that being patient was the only logical thing to do.I had an archer with a sword. I would shoot my most damaging skill while the mobs were far, knock them down when they got too close, then finished with 1 or 2 well timed sword skills.The storylines were nice, the dungeons were even nicer, especially with friends.The loot/equipment was such a joy to acquire, the hoods, the armor!The classes worked so very good, it really was different from the rest.STOPPED FOR A COUPLE OF YEARSCame back around last summer to immerse myself in it again, hoping to catch a glimpse of what it used to be, maybe play a whole week non-stop during my holiday.NOPEClasses are ruined, system is chaotic, you don't work for what you want anymore, there's just too much stuff in your face distracting you from playing the game, the fighting is nowhere as good as it used to be.There's just no adventure anymore, this game used to be about adventure.

number of helpful: 9 of 21 people (43%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 8, 2012
												While this game offers something new and different than your usual MMO, it is unfortunately crippled by many issues. Nexon is an inept company that always fails to get it right the first time. Nexon's first and foremost concern is taking your money. Anything useful, conveient, and in some cases, necessary you will have to pay for. Nexon's customer service is abysmal; commonly taking them over a year to respond to ticket and even longer to actually resolve it, if that ever manages to happen.Servers regularly crash and/or are under maintenance usually for a long time, especially during or after an update in which they inevitably break something. If they aren't, they're usually lagging, sometimes pretty bad. Hell, initally you need to mod the game just to make it acceptable to play.If you do decide to play this game be prepared for attention ♥♥♥♥♥s, severe weeaboos, 12 year old girls, 13 year old boys, adults that act like 12 year old girls and/or 13 year old boys, meme spewing, and rampant hacking. I say more power to them (hackers). There needs to be people that can remind everyone about how bad Nexon sucks with this game.A good game for people with a whole lot of disposible income ( or stealing mommy and daddy's credit card until they notice $100 vanishing every month) and people who can't play anything better.Some pros for those that think (and will probably continue to do so anyway) that I'm being biased: - Very moddable, pretty much everything, from the sun to the UI to the music can be modded into whatever you can find/make.- A good break-away from your typical mmo; offering things other games could learn from.- Interesting battle system. Although with a past update, took a bad turn imo.- Expansive customization from characters to clothes (be prepared to pay for this too though)Check out the forums.

What's more is, if you try to get the BBB involved with trying to get your support ticket noticed (Mabinogi tickets have a 6+ Month waiting time at least) the BBB will tell you that Nexon America has opted out of BBB, and therefore support cannot be given via BBB. (Shows how much they care for customers, etc.)The content updates are quite lacking nowadays, running out of ideas, still trying to milk money out of Mabinogi players, until Mabinogi 2 comes along (No, it's not Vindictus, there WILL be a Mabinogi 2.) Then they will just delete everyone, no refunds, no nothing, clean slate on Mabinogi 2.Of course, this doesn't come without issues. Nexon KR, the parent company of Nexon USA, has always disliked their USA Nexon branch, and maybe won't even push Mabinogi 2 through to it. So in all, if you play anything from Nexon, you're better off just quitting, or following the crowd like sheep or lemmings. 												I tried to like this game, I really did. I was first introduced to the concept of this game, by a fellow student in a Irish folklore and folk life class and it seemed to me to be everything I was looking for in an MMO when it came to lore and interesting mechanics, however that sadly did not turn out to be the case. number of helpful: 4 of 12 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 5, 2013
												It was hard to get into the character, not knowing anything about the game and just being tossed into the world with barely any knowledge of ... well anything.Character cards are ridiculous and make no sense.  Allowing a person to make one character per account or card is just silly and was a big turn off at the beginning.  Then suddenly I'ma  horse running around attacking spiders and wolves but unable to talk to anyone and no idea what was going on.  It's basically a game for older players.  As in, people who have been playing it for a couple of years and have gotten to know one another rather well through the game itself.  Which is fine, if you're looking for a social game.  I was looking for something with more adventure.  This was not that game for me.  Although it does have combat, it's tedious and slow.  With numerous combat progamming issues such as slow to no response, it get boring and annoying very quickly.  If you want to be with your friends from the beginning you have to make the same type of character.  Unless you are one of the players who has played for some time then you're aware of how to get where and what exactly you're doing.  I was enticed by the farming, cooking, trade skill aspects only to learn that those are the main skills you pick from the beginning.  While you're welcome to learn other skills or professions, if you picked cooking then cooking would be the only thing you truly excelled at which gives the game another annoyance factor for me personally.I'm not going to say anything about the graphics because I believe that graphics do not make the game no matter how beautiful or up to date it is, if the game play is awful it is awful and god rays won't save it.  t's dated to be sure but it works for what (I assume) the game is going for.  After awhile I got tired of children players running around and elves with large breasts giggling constantly and decided to try something else.It's a charming thought but all in all this game left me more confused than with the feeling of enjoying a real role playing game.  If you have extensive amounts of time on your hands, do not like social interractions in the real world or are one of the few serious fans left of the game, enjoy.  Otherwise, I would try something else with better, more responsive controls and doesn't rely on extreme amounts of beauty shop items in order to enjoy the "game".
