content:
Posted: February 18, 2014
												For the 32 or so hours it took to download and install this game, it was not worth it. I feel like there should have been more of a tutorial for the game as I had no idea what I was doing. I felt lost, and the character customization was lack-lustre. I expected more options than what was offered to me. A lot of the hair and eye colours and styles were locked until you purchased something. I was also disappointed in the fact that you could not choose your own clothing at the start of the game. This is definitely a game in which you'd want to level up in, and I'm assuming that leveling up in this game takes a long time. However, I will say one thing: the online community present in this game is very helpful and friendly. They were willing to give me and my friend really nice new clothing when we accidentally sold ours and were quick to offer tips and advice on playing this game. My only advice to you is that if you're interested in playing this game, doing extensive online research on how to play the game before playing would be highly reccomended in order for you to have a good start. However keep in mind that my friend and I did a little research; including watching a few "Let's play" videos on youtube, gong to the official website and wiki, and also going to a few fansites, which made us excited for the game and caused us to have high expectations of the game after seeing all the things you could do (after leveling up and/or spending real money). Added to the issues of not knowing how to play the game, and the ridiculously long download time (which after doing some research we discovered that it varied from person to person - one of the people we met on the game waited 3 days whereas some took no time at all), I found that this game was also incredibly boring, especially if you haven't leveled up. It definitely has a slow start and I'd definitely reccomend using a mouse as character movement proved difficult with a trackpad. Combat was confusing and even after I attempted to get through a short training exercise (which I did not complete since there were no tutorial instructions) I was still unable to figure out how to successful maneuver my fighting ability. However, between waiting for the game to install on Steam (which took about 7 hours) and waiting for the patch to download there was still an issue with creating an account. The account creation system we found was buggy and tempermental, and finally after that was dealt with and we were excited to start playing, there was still a patch to install. We found that while this wait was a one time thing, and is a lot faster when downloading from steam as opposed to the game's website, it still took about 22 hours to install, even on a relatively fast computer. While there are still a lot of good things to say on the game, there are more bad ones and in my opinion it all boils down to what your expectations of a MMORPG are. In my case, I was just looking for a fun game with easy-to-use controls and lots of options on what sort of things you can do. The game probably would have been better if new players received an extensive array of items when they first started playing. Things like a starter weapon, a fishing rod and a few more books focussing on starting level abilities associated with your class type would be useful. Overall, this game took way to long to download for how long I played for and for how much I enjoyed the game.

content:
Posted: June 9, 2014
												I tried my hardest to enjoy the game, but the combat was just terrible and there were way, way too many bugs for a game as old as this (If you're wondering it was released in 2004 in korea and 2008 in NA). There were just so many times where I would enter a building and get stuck and have to relog or be fighting an enemy and your character will literally just sit there. With that being said, this MMO is more of a social game rather than a combat game, which isnt really my cup of tea. The graphics are nice but they definitely haven't aged well at all. I think the biggest flaw though is the somewhat Pay-to-win aspect of the game. You almost HAVE to spend a decent amount of money to even make the game convient enough to play. They give you a mount to use, but even then it only lasts for 1 hour and a half each day unless you buy the "permenant" version, and in a game where the quest NPCs are sometimes continents away, you'll find yourself spending more time walking from place to place than actually enjoying yourself.

content:
Posted: March 1, 2014
												 This game is more than just a bad game or a game with too many nerfs, buffs, ecenomic instability, pay to win or anything like that.... all of those are here in one way or another but hear me out, please:Mabinogi is the definition of the game that punishes you for playing it.First off, if you do have a morbid curiosity and decide to start the game, mute it. Immediately. Go into your control panel, turn down the Client.exe or Mabinogi volume through system settings, then play. If you do not do this you will be blasted with late-90's synth music that will at least make you ill, and the remaining sound effects will make you deaf.If you are still playing you will notice that you have nothing to do, and no idea what to do at all. While odds are you won't need the wiki at this point, you will need to do anywhere from 20 to 30 missions depending on the class you picked just to unlock your skills.If you manage to actually do all of these 15 minute long missions for each skill, you should just stop. Close the client, because  what you did was all you should do.You see, the game developers (at least for the north American side of the game) don't actually like it when people play the game, because their "special events" give you more experience for doing half-programed mini-games than actual dungeon crawling, which no one does because dungeon crawling is obsolete, and has been for years. How? simple: buying "gachapins" from the real-money shop can give items that are better than anything you will ever find in any dungeon. What about making the armor with blacksmiths? NOPE: event and gachapin items have better stats than anything a blacksmith can make. The newest lifeskills even? nope, new armor an weapons where released a few months later. Anything that doesn't involve throwing away real money and standing around doing nothing will just make you a second-rate character, and sometimes, you just have to sit around and do nothing, since most events reward you if you're AFK!The only thing that 90% of people do in this game is sit around town in their outfits, or try to make money by doing event mini games to make money. The few people who actually play the game typically hate what the game has become, and would play something else if they hadn't invested so much time and money in the game.Oh, did I mention that the story will make your eyes bleed? Don't read the fluff text, especially if it involves Shakespeare.TL;DR: doing nothing in this game is more rewarding than actually playing it. Do not waste your time and sanity.

number of helpful: 6 of 17 people (35%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 23, 2014
												What can I say about this "Thrill-Ride" of a F2P game? Sorry for the ovbious sarcasm, but let's take a look at Mabinogi:This game first off immediately tries to♥♥♥♥♥♥you off by playing super-loud music at the start screen that you can't change until you've made a character. Now I know what you're thinking: There's a mute button stupid, but at the same time an experienced friend of mine is trying to teach me the basic stuff about the game. To add to that, the game is impossible to figure out unless you have a friend guiding you the whole way. Also, the game is ridiculously slow-paced and boring with just everything that you do. The combat system is ridiculously tedious and annoying to use. When you first create a character, you instantly discover you can only have one character per account and VERY limited customization options. If you try to create a male character, it will always look like a female. The pay to win system is unbelievably bad and stuff costs way too much. The resolution isn't even optimized for all screen resolutions so it looked really sluggish to me. Everything in the game looked horrible and low-res. There is tremendous lag on every server and channel even though I have way above the recommended system specs for this game. The worst part is, the customer support for the game by the publishers, Nexon, are unresponsive and couldn't care less for the community. The servers are practically barren and the few people I find outside of the 2 friends that tried to guide me through the game never leave me alone and spam the chat like crazy. The first guy you meet, Duncan literally tells you that: "All of these jobs may seem boring to you." So heed his warning. The only things that are nice about this game is that it is a bit different from other mmos and the story is set up well. But other than that, this feels like a boring, tedious, annoying, and a confusing experience the whole way through. This game is slowly dying so I advise not to get in to it. The sad thing is, I hear from lots of dedicated players that the game was decent when it first came out back in 2003, but then Nexon screwed it up significantly. The worst part is, there are way better Free-To-Play MMOs like Planetside 2, Warframe, SWTOR, Rusty Hearts, Cosmic Break, and so on. This game was so bad that my testicles committed suicide due to the lack of testosterone considering that no matter what you do to customize your character, you'll always look like a female! Not being sexist or anything, but I want to look like my own gender please, come on now Nexon!To sum it up, this isn't just a bad F2P MMO, it's probably one of the worst F2P MMOs I've ever played. Just do yourself a favor and just play a different F2P game unless you enjoy grinding for several hours just to earn or do anything that is cool or fun at all.P.S. This game killed my son and I became an alcoholic thanks to this game.

number of helpful: 7 of 19 people (37%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 16, 2012
												A good MMO if you don't want do battle. The battle system sucks and is frustrating as hell, however the music system is original and good, it allows you to put any song you want into the game, if you know how.On the music system there is a lot to offer, ranging from different instruments to creating your own music score, solo or band optimized.The music system is the largest pull of the game, and is certainly what got me to get the game and stay in it for longer than I care to admit.Be wary of the "free" grab as well, everything is free except quite a lot of the game, which can be frustrating because to have more than one character, you have to buy, to have your character look unique, you have to buy.However it has addicting game play and interesting NON-combat orientated systems, but the moment you get into the combat, you're greeted by a poorly designed system, that not only makes it boring to fight, but painful, on that note the combat side feels ignored, the drop rate ratios are far from decent, and the dice roll based damages, can be quite unforgiving for new players, or Australian players, as there are no Australian servers which makes latency, a royal pain in the left butt cheek.This game gets a 4/10 from me.

number of helpful: 3 of 11 people (27%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 16, 2013
												Okay, I'll give a serious review of this game now.I've wasted about $7000 dollars and 9 years of my life playing this game, and in the end if you asked me if it was worth it, I'd say hell no.This game has an inferior game engine that has been used like a beaten horse since 2006. There are no scheduled plans for this game's engine to get the update it so desperately needs, and because of this, the game suffers extreme lag day in and day out.The community of this game is toxic as all hell, not as toxic as say, League of Legends, but pretty ♥♥♥♥in' bad.The game's systems are outdated, and while I will say this: I have enjoyed several aspects of the game, from the fast-paced, skill-based combat, to the fact that you can use a programming language (MML: Musical Markup Language) to literally creat your own pieces of music; the game is severely lacking in other aspects, such as proper guild-managment systems and end-game content. Recently, you might say, they added a new dungeon that is consider end game, but that is only accessable through months of grinding to get to a minimum level of 3000, and that's not the hardest variation of said dungeon, which, to reach, you need to have a minimum level of 7000, and good luck finding someone to help you out with that.Speaking of which, something the community has asked for time and again is the server merge the game so desperately needs, as whenever I do log on, I see maybe 5-6 people on my friendslist of 300 people actually online.And you might be also asking, but Gil, what's that $7000 up there about? Well, I'm glad you asked, because instead of offering meaning and worthwhile content, the devs of this game would rather♥♥♥♥♥♥out the ugliest, worthless and most useless piles of♥♥♥♥♥♥items through their "Gachapon" systems that they try so hard to grab your hard-earned money with almost every 2 weeks when they put them up for sale. I have attained a literal gambling addiction, from spending so much money trying to get the stupidest ♥♥♥♥ing things in these last 9 years, and I've accrued so much debt that I now require to sell some stuff to make up for the debt of all the money I wasted throughout the years.I will say this to everyone, and everytime I'm asked if this is a good game to play, my answer will always be the same: NO. DO. NOT. PLAY. THIS. GAME. IT. IS. A. WASTE. OF. TIME. MONEY. AND. EFFORT.

content:
Posted: November 19, 2015
												Stay away from it while you can.~Axelrod of AlexinaIf you want an explanation, literally all of the hours that I've put into this game have gone into AFKing. If there was a point where I wasn't AFK, it was because I was talking to friends. Why nothing else?Your input is delayed if you don't adjust your network settings, the game's so unoptimized that the font they use is even capable of causing frame skips, and any new content they have have gets stuffed into a gachapon.What's a gachapon?A gachapon is a form of gambling that is legal for people of any age if you do it in Mabinogi, as long as you convert your real money into a fake currency they call NX and spend your NX on these boxes that are more likely to have garbage inside of them than what's advertised. And the people who localize this game even embrace gachapons enough to make them into a Steam emoticon.So I'll re-emphasize my point. Stay away from this game while you can. This review update was brought to you by a bored Axelrod on 3/28/2016.

												Mabinogi. When i found this on a top ten list of anime mmo's, i got rather excited, and couldnt wait to play the game. From what ive seen, its really good! trailer is cool, showing what looks like a robust open world to live in , rather than play in. Un fortunatly, thats where to good stuff ends. After a one hour download for the files (3.8gb) in steam (not much, but wait. there's more), i went to play the game, thinking it should be fine, it's downloaded. 27 HOURS later, the 3.9gb patch FINALLY finished downloading (why take so long? *shrug*). Ok, so long downloads are nothing new. lets play. Iplay for 5min, looking awesome... then crash. 900mb update. ok, still going, still wanting to play the game. play again. number of helpful: 3 of 13 people (23%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 25, 2014
												I agree with StalkingEmu this game is also bad beacause one of it's main ways to draw players in using a sexual fanbase. Just look at the woman on the cover, COME ON REALLY!*THIS IS HIS REVIEW*What can I say about this "Thrill-Ride" of a F2P game? Sorry for the ovbious sarcasm, but let's take a look at Mabinogi:This game first off immediately tries to ♥♥♥♥ you off by playing super-loud music at the start screen that you can't change until you've made a character. Now I know what you're thinking: There's a mute button stupid, but at the same time an experienced friend of mine is trying to teach me the basic stuff about the game. To add to that, the game is impossible to figure out unless you have a friend guiding you the whole way. Also, the game is ridiculously slow-paced and boring with just everything that you do. The combat system is ridiculously tedious and annoying to use. When you first create a character, you instantly discover you can only have one character per account and VERY limited customization options. If you try to create a male character, it will always look like a female. The pay to win system is unbelievably bad and stuff costs way too much. The resolution isn't even optimized for all screen resolutions so it looked really sluggish to me. Everything in the game looked horrible and low-res. There is tremendous lag on every server and channel even though I have way above the recommended system specs for this game. The worst part is, the customer support for the game by the publishers, Nexon, are unresponsive and couldn't care less for the community. The servers are practically barren and the few people I find outside of the 2 friends that tried to guide me through the game never leave me alone and spam the chat like crazy. The first guy you meet, Duncan literally tells you that: "All of these jobs may seem boring to you." So heed his warning. The only things that are nice about this game is that it is a bit different from other mmos and the story is set up well. But other than that, this feels like a boring, tedious, annoying, and a confusing experience the whole way through. This game is slowly dying so I advise not to get in to it. The sad thing is, I hear from lots of dedicated players that the game was decent when it first came out back in 2003, but then Nexon screwed it up significantly. The worst part is, there are way better Free-To-Play MMOs like Planetside 2, Warframe, SWTOR, Rusty Hearts, Cosmic Break, and so on. This game was so bad that my testicles committed suicide due to the lack of testosterone considering that no matter what you do to customize your character, you'll always look like a female! Not being sexist or anything, but I want to look like my own gender please, come on now Nexon!To sum it up, this isn't just a bad F2P MMO, it's probably one of the worst F2P MMOs I've ever played. Just do yourself a favor and just play a different F2P game unless you enjoy grinding for several hours just to earn or do anything that is cool or fun at all.P.S. This game killed my son!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 20, 2015
												Having not even 10 hours into ann MMO game, so my point of view is only really of the first impressions I got of the game.  10 hours is still a hefty amount of time spent on one thing, though, and do I have a wall of text of an opinion on it.VISUAL:  Nothing noteworthy graphics-wise, if not even decent.  It’s a shame you can’t see more of what’s happening since the draw distance is abysmal, even with highest settings.  The camera will go out of control in certain areas (such as Bangor with their tight cliff walls), and one of my first game experiences had me stuck in the first quest giver’s building as the camera glitched out and could not zoom or focus enough to see the exit door and leave.The minimap is only useful for seeing where you are, as by default it shows no other players and party members are represented by delayed or outright wrong last seen locations.  The HUD is your standard MMO fare, but beware when you increase the resolution; it shows its age and the thing becomes so small it is near unreadable.SOUND:  Really not much to say here, it will probably be too loud by default when you first start it up.GAMEPLAY:  Skill system seems like a good idea on paper, being able to strengthen which skills you want by using them more often and in certain ways, but quickly shows its flaws.  “Windmill” move in particular, unless you use this move exclusively early game I don’t know how one can max this skill out.  I got to the point where it will only gain experience if I use it on “powerful” enemies, but even using it on enemies classified so soon became impossible; progression on the move completely stalled simply because I leveled up too much before the exponential growth of the enemies overtook me.  Even using it on a dungeon boss did not qualify as being “powerful” despite being able to destroy our entire group with one swing.  Which brings me to the next issue, the rampant spikes in enemy strength.  The particular dungeon was filled with goblins and imps that we could all easily defeat without a scratch on us, if they even get a chance to hit us before we systematically genocide the entire ruin.   Then comes out the bosses (plural), each one we can barely put a dent in before severely or outright killing a member of the party.  Practically no prior warning to the sudden player abuse that was waiting for us.  Similar experiences from friends who were grinding in the underpowered monster areas that for some odd reason had something incredibly more powerful mixed in.The combat system does not help fight them either.  While, once again, the pseudo RPS and timing oriented turn based combat sounds at least a step above an average click-based combat, connection issues plagued half the battles I was involved in.  Animations skipped and enemies warped, my computer and internet was more than enough to handle this game, yet I easily kept getting stunlocked due to me sometimes not being able to make a move from the input lag (unless this is normal, then which case being stunlocked by PvE is ♥♥♥♥ing annoying).When not in combat, the inventory is a mess.  Items had no pattern that I could see whether it could be stacked or not, a single sheet of paper can take up the same amount of space as a pair of shoes, if items can be stacked most of the times they cannot be stacked high, if you were to accidentally use a stack of items for a cooking ingredient the entire stack was used instead of the single item, etc. etc.  The worst was how much space gold takes up the inventory, especially considering how ridiculously expensive everything is, even more so considering how as a beginner player most of it was practically inaccessible.TL;DR:  Everything feels clunky, and a common thought while playing the game was: “This could be done better.” 3/10

content:
Posted: March 17, 2014
												Definitely pay to win, but if you don't mind a little grind you can do basically everything without paying a dime. To a lot of people that means a lot, but not so much to me. What I find most appealing about this game is the classless system, you can make your character anything and at any point you can change your mind and pick up something else. You aren't limited to one type of weapon or skill set based on the race you play or the weapon and skill set you choose to start with. Over time they have improved the tutorials at the beginning of the game to make it easier for new players to get started and the community in this game always seems to have a friendly vibe. Overall, it's a great game and I would recommend it. If you're hesitant about it, it's free and trying it can't hurt. It runs on low spec systems fairly well and has a good look to it even though it's aging as an MMO. What you won't find here are cutting edge graphics and animations, but it makes up for it in gameplay. Not saying the animations or graphics are bad, they are very good considering the generation of MMOs this game comes from.

content:
Posted: May 10, 2014
												I've spent almost two years on this game, and I've gotta say, I'm still sticking around.It's a unique game. Everything can be obtained, and there really is no true p2w. I guess it'd be p2getitemseasier.It's skill and leveling system is different compared to other games. There is no true level cap, and as long as you rebirth, you can keep on restarting from level 1 and getting AP all over again. There are no classes you choose. Simply equip the weapon you want to use, and have the skill. Weapons are unique as well. There are no "Level 50 Behemoth Sword". all weapons can be used from the get-go, excluding racial restrictions.Verdict: It's fun. Try it out if you think you might like it, and if you think you won't, still, try it out.

												Quite possibly one of the most annoying games I have ever played. Getting past the passwords for Nexon and Mabinogi popup and hotscreen to even play are ridiculous and getting your first skill is beyond annoying. I chose archer and the targeting system has you pressing multiple keys and resetting multiple times for each attack which is stupid. You dont get much of a character choice or pet choice unless you pay for facial expressions and get "tickets" for all the other extras. So for such a dinky little game with awkward controls and lousy targeting system it isnt worth a penny of my money. Glad this was a free to play or I would be upset.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 4, 2013
												A fantastic game run by a 'meh' company. The game is great, there's plenty of content so you'll rarely be stuck with nothing to do. To add to that, this game focuses on the idea of a 'fantasy life', so you're not just forced into fighting monsters all day long. There's a lot of different things to do, and it's up to you to decide what your personal goals are. The biggest problem with the game is that it isn't very beginner friendly, even after a few attempts to make the game easier for beginners. You'll probably want help from someone who plays the game avidly to help you get a good idea of how things work out. The main thing to remember is that this is a game, so just enjoy yourself. Everyone who plays this game wants to have a nice fantasy life, so try not to ruin it for them and they shouldn't try to ruin it for you, either.

content:
Posted: May 9, 2014
												To make this fairly simple for those who want to know if this game is worth playing, i say yes...however thats simply not enough to be said about this game, because for all the time ive played video games and what ive labled as a "bad" game this game has... 1.poor visuals: this games graphics are very simple and... like most games that try to do the anime style onto a 3D modle it translates oddly.2. it is buggy as ♥♥♥♥... you see monsters stuck on themselves ALL the time.3. you gotta pay into it to get the most outta it.so by those factors alone, one would think... why waste the time then? Well my inquisative gamers ill tell you why, its been the best experiance i have had with a "fantasy-life" MMO, its strange sounding, especially with the afformentioned problems.the possiblity of customization is insane and the open class system is well done, want to be a knight? well congrates get a lance and you learn the basic knight skills. want to be a mage? well thats covered, want to be a druid that transforms into animals like WoW? well guess what thats in there too.  (not to mention you have a crap ton of things to turn into, from a useless chicken, to a dragon, to one of you favorite NPC's) the games subtle details are very nice like food affecting your weight, ageing and getting taller, your charector looks at a player after they type things in. and the sence of acheivemnt is pretty good in this game, making a weapon for the first time felt REALLY awesome because it was a lagitamently difficult.To make a pretty broad statement about this game this game looks like crap, smells like crap , but tastes like paradise,and im almost certain if nexon did a mabinogi 2, with cell shading, voice actors, and stomped out the stupid bugs... you would be looking at the next greatest MMO

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 24, 2014
												I am going to try and write an endepth and fair review for this game including what i love and what i hate. ill break it down into 3 catagories 1.The Good 2. The bad and 3. The Ugly        So lets start with the good. mabinogi is a f2p game that does not treat you like a second class citizen when you play it. you can earn alot of things most games would make you pay for from either other players or just hard work. The community is also very nice unlike world of warcraft or other mmos ive played. most people i have met are kind and friendly and love to help new players out. A majority of the community seems like weeaboos but hey they are nice weeaboos. The combat system is very unique and is adaptable to almost any play style although some skills are just straight up better than others. almost every class is viable and if you are not happy with your class you can swap it in 3 weeks or 1 day if you are under level 100.          The bad. This mmo used to be predatory. very pay to win and there are alot of things from the past that come to haunt you. for example the generation quests. in order to beat the final boss of Generation 3 you will NEED someone who is about level 1000 or higher to help you beacuse it is a gaint dragon who does massive aoe 4000 damage attacks.  (at this point you will have about 150 heatlh). there are still a few pay to win elements for exampe you could buy a cloud that will heal you when you summon it. sounds alright right? well what if you buy 4 of them? you got a chain of full health aoe heals for the low low price of 60 dollars. Want the best upgrade for your weapon? be prepared to grind for hundreds of hours to repair it or just pay 5$.           Another thing is the economy. Do you wanna study how inflation works in an economy run by 15 year olds? well mabinogi is a great case study. anything remotley nice costs about 200000 to 500000 gold so once again do you wanna grind for hours and hours or do you wanna just buy expensive items from the store and sell them to players? although  I need to preface my gripes about pay to win by saying it is getting better. in fact it already is better in korea and we just gotta hope they keep updating the american version. you can not just grind levels infinetly beacuse the game has a system called rebirthing. rebirthing sets your level back to 1 but lets you keep all your skills. if you do not rebirth once you hit level 50 or so it becomes very very hard to level up and you have to wait 3 weeks to rebirth again. just another annoying progress blockerThe ugly. The art style is ALL OVER THE PLACE. very much influenced by korean culture even though the game is set in a mythical european setting. immersion breaking does not even begin to describe the cosmetics in this game. it is worse than tf2. You play as a bunch of immortal demigods so i guess it makes sense that they copy clothes from earth but still it makes no damn sense. I have alot more to say about the game but im sick of typing so ill wrap it up. The game is fun VERY FRUSTRATING. but fun and hey it is free just be sure to read up♥♥♥♥♥♥on the wiki and make friends and you will have a good time. Do not buy the starter packs on steam they are worthless garbage learn the game before you make any purchases (I apologize for the grammar and spelling mistakes i am to damn lazy to go through and spell check this.)

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 11, 2015
												I need help, this game is stealing my time and I don't know what to do....Let me start off by saying this game is literally going to be the largest fight of your life. Constant crashes are an issue. Sluggish combat is an issue. A pretty boring first 15 hours is an issue. However, if you are able to look past this games flaws, and have a good few number of friends to play it with, this game is completely worth the go.Mabinogi is an anime based MMORPG with a large player base keeping the game alive to this day from the time of its original release. Time really hasn't done this game that many favors, however. It's optimization options are acceptable, but not really great. The gameplay itself is hard to explain, as for an MMO, it doesn't really work like a typical one. Combat is sluggish as stated above, and is needed regardless of whether you choose a life taleny or combat talent, as the entirety of the story requires you have certain key points of skill for each stage of it. There are several classes, a whole lot of them in fact. Do you wanna be a ninja? Go for it. Want to go gunslinger with duel pistols? You can do that.However as stated before, combat talents aren't the only skills you can use. Life talents are talent lines that go under typical jobs of other MMO's and has a lot of depth to it. Being a tailor in this game is deeper than in any other MMO where it is generally side casted into being a part time thing you maybe, sometime do.The game is currently on Generation 19, which means, you have an entirity of 19 Storylines to go through, and each one is a long and hard journey. The story itself in the game is, enjoyable. I liked it a great deal in fact. The writting within it isn't that great, however. It's not terrible, but sometimes feels really awkward. The music in this game is horrible, on the flip side. Sure, a lot of it can sound generally alright if not forgetable. But altogether, I find it almost earbleeding levels of bad. Another bad thing about the game is the economy. Holy hell, the freaking economy in this game. Want anything that wont make you look newbish? That'll be about 300,000 Gold please. It's an extremely annoying thing, but in all fairness, around my 60th hour of play time I was making an average of 150,000 gold per play session of about 5-6 Hours each. It's not so bad, and you'll make more and more money if you just keep at it.Altogether though, I don't think I could completely cover everything in Mabinogi. All I can really do, is sum it up like this. This game is flawed. Extremely, badly, horribly, flawed. But for anyone willing to look past all the things wrong with it, and for anyone who's been looking for an Anime themed MMO, you should really give this game a go. Ignore my rating for those reasons, it's just there BECAUSE of all the problems I have with it, but I still love it.6/10 - Some Loser

												Honestly the best MMO i've ever played despite its age. I put and invested countless hours into this game off steam (which shows in the lack of hours.) The number one reason why this game isn't as famous as it should be is because it's simply owned by Nexon. The company has ruined many popular titles such as MapleStory, Dungeon Fighter Online, and yes that includes Mabinogi. All games are still popular in korea, but due to the INSANE price differences in the Korea version VS. the NA version cash shops, this MMO constantly has you spending 3x-4x more than an average Korean player. If this game was owned by another company such as Riot Games, or another known good company with a good sense of customer relations, this would easily topple the gaming industry in terms of Fantasy MMOs. Highly recommend if you're going to spend thousands of dollars on this "f2p" mmo to try and buy Final Fantasy 14 Online. Yes its subscription, but in the end its a lot cheaper than Nexon's "f2p" mmos.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 20, 2015
												Having not even 10 hours into ann MMO game, so my point of view is only really of the first impressions I got of the game.  10 hours is still a hefty amount of time spent on one thing, though, and do I have a wall of text of an opinion on it.VISUAL:  Nothing noteworthy graphics-wise, if not even decent.  It’s a shame you can’t see more of what’s happening since the draw distance is abysmal, even with highest settings.  The camera will go out of control in certain areas (such as Bangor with their tight cliff walls), and one of my first game experiences had me stuck in the first quest giver’s building as the camera glitched out and could not zoom or focus enough to see the exit door and leave.The minimap is only useful for seeing where you are, as by default it shows no other players and party members are represented by delayed or outright wrong last seen locations.  The HUD is your standard MMO fare, but beware when you increase the resolution; it shows its age and the thing becomes so small it is near unreadable.SOUND:  Really not much to say here, it will probably be too loud by default when you first start it up.GAMEPLAY:  Skill system seems like a good idea on paper, being able to strengthen which skills you want by using them more often and in certain ways, but quickly shows its flaws.  “Windmill” move in particular, unless you use this move exclusively early game I don’t know how one can max this skill out.  I got to the point where it will only gain experience if I use it on “powerful” enemies, but even using it on enemies classified so soon became impossible; progression on the move completely stalled simply because I leveled up too much before the exponential growth of the enemies overtook me.  Even using it on a dungeon boss did not qualify as being “powerful” despite being able to destroy our entire group with one swing.  Which brings me to the next issue, the rampant spikes in enemy strength.  The particular dungeon was filled with goblins and imps that we could all easily defeat without a scratch on us, if they even get a chance to hit us before we systematically genocide the entire ruin.   Then comes out the bosses (plural), each one we can barely put a dent in before severely or outright killing a member of the party.  Practically no prior warning to the sudden player abuse that was waiting for us.  Similar experiences from friends who were grinding in the underpowered monster areas that for some odd reason had something incredibly more powerful mixed in.The combat system does not help fight them either.  While, once again, the pseudo RPS and timing oriented turn based combat sounds at least a step above an average click-based combat, connection issues plagued half the battles I was involved in.  Animations skipped and enemies warped, my computer and internet was more than enough to handle this game, yet I easily kept getting stunlocked due to me sometimes not being able to make a move from the input lag (unless this is normal, then which case being stunlocked by PvE is ♥♥♥♥ing annoying).When not in combat, the inventory is a mess.  Items had no pattern that I could see whether it could be stacked or not, a single sheet of paper can take up the same amount of space as a pair of shoes, if items can be stacked most of the times they cannot be stacked high, if you were to accidentally use a stack of items for a cooking ingredient the entire stack was used instead of the single item, etc. etc.  The worst was how much space gold takes up the inventory, especially considering how ridiculously expensive everything is, even more so considering how as a beginner player most of it was practically inaccessible.TL;DR:  Everything feels clunky, and a common thought while playing the game was: “This could be done better.” 3/10

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 2, 2015
												First, let's start with the obvious. This game is free to play, doesn't require a powerful computer, or much hard drive space, and it's free. Why not do yourself a favor and give it an hour or two, see if you'll like it? I really didn't think I'd like it; I'm generally not interested in this kind of stuff. My hours demonstrate that I did in fact find that I do enjoy Mabinogi, quite a bit. I think you'll like it too. Now, this will probably get long-winded. You've been warned ♥ If you won't or can't read all of this, know that Mabinogi is a fantastic game, with a curiously diverse community and a continuously changing series of old and new events designed to draw in and keep both new and experienced Mellitians. You start out creating a character. Create a Human, with your 6 free character cards, make 6 humans, all on the server you choose to play on. I play mostly on Tarlach, and would have used the 6 free cards to put them all on the Tarlach server had I known this before. So, for each human you make, you'll be able to talk with the leader of the elves, and giants, and support that respective faction. With each human character (but only one of them per day) you can choose to support one faction each irl day, which gives you a new character card for that particular race. Your 6 human characters then become 18 characters, 6 human, 6 elves, and 6 giants, which gives you more bank tab inventory space and a higher maximum gold ceiling for the bank.You'll be able to "rebirth" once a day until one of your characters hits a cumulative (total, including levels from previous incarnations) level of 1,000. After which you'll be able to rebirth once every 6 days, each time you'll be able to change your gender, skin color, facial features, age, the talent you choose will give more experience points, and you'll be able to rank up skills for your chosen talent faster also. I advise that new players first pick close combat, because the most crucial skills for survival can be found in the close combat talent, such as Counterattack, Smash, Light and Heavy Armor Mastery, Sword Mastery, stuff like that, that will help fortify your stats like Strength (helps determine your base dmg) and raises your HP (health points, or hit points, whatever, the number that means you're KO'ed when it hits 0). After you've gotten slightly accustomed to the camera and character movement of the game (it's a little awkward at first), you'll maybe want to find somebody in nice clothes that looks like they know what they're doing, and strike up a conversation. Generally, Mabi players are for the most part generous and helpful. Don't be surpirsed if it seems like somebody doubts you're a newbie, as some rather experienced players ocassionally troll as newbies with underdevoloped characters, for the lulz (I've done it too). Don't be worried about what you should be doing, because there's really nothing you're supposed to be doing, other than whatever you feel like doing. You can focus exlusively on doing main quests and sagas, or developing your combat skills, or cooking skills, or tailoring skills, or running commerce, or you can just stand around and chat with others, or run Shadow Missions in an alternate plane of reality for gold, experience, and other goodies. You can play however you like, at your own pace, and never spend a dime. Although, the things in the cash shop are not actually necessary, they're for the most part nice enough that you might end up saving up for some things (they're generally not very expenisve though). You can join a guild, or form a guild (guild creation is reserved for paying players), you can rank music related skills and put on a concert, or you could spend a good amount of time just exploring the large and varied world of Erinn.Mabinogi offers a great plethora of potential avenues, and being free to play, I cannot in good conscious recommend against trying Mabinogi. What do you have to lose? Come play with us, we're having a great time!

content:
Posted: February 11, 2013
												Mabinogi is a very drab game. It advertises endless possibilities and mountains of content, when in reality the only real things you can do involve trading and stabbing bears. The combat is too lopsided, the story is too KAWAII-DESUUUUUU~ and the economy is a huge mess. Dungeons are boasted as in-depth and randomly generated, which they are (kinda). Small enemies can kill you just as quickly as you can kill them, and bosses require a couple of players (or luck, in most cases) to beat, which kills it for me because I like being able to solo most things. Armor does nothing, surprisingly, and you're better off saving your money up for weapons and potions than splurging on armor. There's also a wound system that requires you to use bandages before potions do any good, forcing you to waste even more time. Everything is a grind and nothing is rewarding. Good luck getting anything done. Trust me, you'll need it.

content:
Posted: January 1, 2016
												This game is pretty great. The graphics are out-dated, but the community is good and generally helpful. There is no P2W concept, you can buy pets which can help you carry loot and junk, but they aren't going to win any battles for you. The learning curve is there and noticeable, but once you get a grasp of the game it's easy to work with. It's an overall fun game, and has loads of potential and variety for you to look into. But some patience might be required, and having and making friends to play with will certainly make the experience more fun. The story is also great and in-depth and all the characters you meet have some fleshy story to them.All in all I would rate this game a strong 8/10,  if it had better graphics and more streamlined combat like say Tera or something then I would say this is probably the closest to a perfect MMO you'll find.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 19, 2015
												I hate that I don't hate this game. It's like drowning in anime. I'm going to keep this brief, because my 120+ hours logged in speaks for itself.What it's got: A robust system that allows you to do what you want. No. Really. Like, if you want to do stuff and slay the beasts, you can do it. There are even events where you run around and eat food, gain experience, and talk to strangers, and that nets you what you need. It's surprisingly in-depth.Also I can play "Light Up The Night" on a Mandolin, and it gives buffs.What it lacks: Gameplay. Spellcheck. An upgrade to their graphics. Listenable music. A compelling story. Characters that make me care. Sensible players. A stable gold economy. A skip button for cutscenes. Special effects that look good. A proper lighting system. Less monotonous gameplay. Anything that makes any real sense (I'm not talking about "Oh fantasy should have realism, no I'm talking cohesion). Things that involve you in the world (though the Giant/Elf war was really cool, and made me feel like I was actually involved. Giants for life.) Less ugly visuals (though the character portraits are eons better than what they were).And you know what the worst part is? Even though I uninstalled it, I know I'm gonna pick it up again in a year, unless Guild Wars 2 finally saves me from my strange and terrible MMO fixation.If you like MMOs, give this a try. It's unique. It's not good, but it's unique. You might even find it addictive, if you can see past it's flaws, but as it is, there's so many other games you can play, that if you haven't already sunken either a massive amount of time or money into this one, it's not worth much past poking in your head to see what the fuss is about.

content:
Posted: August 21, 2015
												I have played Mabinogi on and off for years, yet it still is always able to draw me back into the game sometime down the road with new interesting content. Although I have only played 200ish hours on steam, I have played since before the release of "Pioneers of Iria" (appx. late 2008 - early '09). The Pros: - many many skills - no specific class restrictions ( you can be a dual-sword-wielding, fireball-ing, gunslinging, musical chef if you want ) - most items can be dyed to what colors you wish - Most, if not all, storylines have been streamlined - Addition of Talents, which are like titles for how proficient you are in certain skill sets (i.e. combat, magic, music etc.) - The Saga storylines give your character a chance to be a part of "episodes", like a tv series. - Continually seems to come out with events / updatesThe Cons: - Pets are extremely hard to get these days without paying cash - In some areas, on some channels, the LAG IS REAL. - Cash shop items are EXPENSIVE. For example, buying a 15,000 Nx pet? That will be $15 US. - The economy of gold seems to be rather pricy on certain, desirable items. ( 20 million+ gold for a set of "eh" wings ) - Dyes are expensive. Overall, I'd recommend Mabinogi with a 8.75/10. There are some issues, but aren't there issues with every mmo out there? And although this game is "old" ( 2006 release ), it's still alive and kicking.

content:
Posted: March 1, 2015
												This game is fabulous and bad at the same time. If there was a neutral button toward a review, this would be the one game I'd use it on. Here are some pro's & con's.Con's first, cause' it will grab your attention at the very finest.PS: , I mention this later but, I have around 2500 hours on this game and I've played for four years. Don't take my hours on the steam platform for granted please :)Cons:*BAD support, as far as I know, only half the people in their customer/tech support system actually do their job.*Money-hungry company, this game is 'considered' a pay to win due to the mere impossibility of doing things without money near-end game, but it's still a great experience otherwise.*Not much customization, in outfits, near early-game, which is rather considerably okay how they deal with it. Not really a con.//Some of these con's deal with the company that franchises it, the gameplay is, heavily, HEAVILY, different.Pros:*Epic combinations of skills that will leave you on your seat when you happen to get that unexpected boss kill ;D*Best community out there for a [mainly] free2play game.*Grand amounts of customization near mid-game, leading to epic skill combos, neat outfits, tools..*DUAL WIELDING, do I HAVE to explain this? They handle it so well.*It doesn't feel like a grind in the beginning or middle, near late game is where grindy stuff happens.*Memorable times...!*A VARIETY of amazing skills such as fishing, making a campfire, cooking even! These were added to make the game more realistic and overall bondworthy toward. It also makes some killer picnic's.*Realistic-like PVP , or, in this case, Duels. You literally walk up to someone, ask them if they want to duel. A menu comes up, you set the pre-requisites straight forward and get dueling. You aren't FORCED to do it either, and you can make good friends off of it.*Graphics are easy to render, a lower-end / mid-end computer could easily run 30-100FPS. The game was made around 2000-something if I recall. The graphics still look amazing though.//*Death penalty system is not degradeful, hated, or anything in particular. It is annoying when you die, you get Nao stones to revive on full health sometimes though, and even if you do die, you don't lose anything. There is a chance when you die you may lose your gear if its expensive and not blessed by a certain item, but you can get it back at a town hall for a .. 'reasonable yet sometimes a pain in the♥♥♥♥♥ kind of price.//*And finally, its NOT a rage game. Well, not easily alas. Sometimes there are mobs that can truly p1ss off someone but other than that, you don't lose very much.//\\Oh and, don't take my hours for granted. This game was just recently platformed on steam, it used to be on the companies website, which doesn't, as you may know, transfer hours over to here.I've played Mabinogi for four years! Highly inactive, but I at least have 2500 hours on the game and I've witnessed all the stuff they've done on it.//\\This is a more TL:DR Version::!!//\\There are plenty more cons to the game, but they are outweighed heavily by the amount of pros this game contains. The community is so well knitted together that even a child could have fun without any pervs or foul language to watch out for. It's fun, engaging, and most of all, it's made for a community. You can manage epic combos in combat, you can even have pets. Its pretty cool, and is definitely worth trying.However, the support service/s are typically bad, but you can still manage a refund if you didn't get something you payed for. They are money hungry , as they support many different games imported from Japan, and I can understand that. When they ask for too much money though, its pretty noticable. Back on the topic of the game though, there isn't much customization in the beginning, so its kind of boring. If you keep on going though, you'll find it pretty epic overall.--//...An even more TL;DR version..!! ;//\\Fun / Engaging game; but has a bad support service / company. It is a near pay to win at the end, but it is still very fun. It's also very involved with the community, most people are friendly and you don't have to watch out for swear-a-holics. A 9 year old could play this and learn to be kind from the community, most of the time.//OVERALL SCORE, the moment you've been waiting for..I give this game an 8.5 / 10  !!The reason I knocked off 1.5 points was rather simple, just the bad service and company it is owned by in America and the 'noticable yet not overkill' hunger for money they desire to keep the game rolling. Here is a more in-depth explanation.+1 - Great graphic design, even for a game made near 2000. It can also handle lower-end computers well.+3 - Epic community for a free-to-play game, it is very well knitted together, its hard to rip apart. Very hard.+4.5 - Amazing combat system, PVP, and gameplay in general. Has a killer storyline too.-1.5 - Aside from all that, the game has a bad support system and is a mere pay to win near the end. You can still have a great time though.Thanks for reading through this, I hope I've told you the most I could about this fabulous game.-~Kon

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 15, 2015
												If you love MMORPGs and anime, you'll love Mabinogi. If you love the freedom of being able to learn whatever skill you want, even if it doesn't involve combat, you'll love Mabinogi. Here are some pros and cons of the game.Pros--Decent tutorials that teach you how to effectively use the skills related to your chosen talent. Whether it's close combat or archery; smithing or cooking, the game will teach you how to use your skills so you aren't left wondering just what a certain skill does.--HUGE skill tree, including plenty of "life skills." Seriously, you can do almost anything in Mabinogi. There's regular combat skills you learn as you master your previous combat skills, etc. and then there's also PLENTY of skills called life skills to learn. These life skills are generally crafting skills, such as carpentry or smithing; or it also includes skills such as how to rest or how to build a campfire. When combined, Rest and Campfire can help immensely with healing your injuries and stamina.--Tons of quests! Mabinogi has plenty of quests for players to do! A lot of the quests are automatically received via owl, such as event quests, new skill quests, and Generation quests (storyline quests), so you oftentimes won't have to worry about finding a quest yourself. If you do the ones you already have and then turn them in, it's likely that an owl will fly over your head and drop another quest down to you sometime inbetween doing things for your current quest.--Three playable races! Three may not seem like much, but Mabinogi delivers them rather well and I personally am in no complaint as to how many races there are! The races are as follows: The Giants, who are mainly used as warriors, and cannot equip a bow of any type, making them incapable of learning archery related skills; the Elves, who are very good at magic and archery, their specialized stats being dexterity, intelligence, and mana. However, elves are also a special race that are limited to what they can do, as they cannot dual weild any weapons, with the exception of puppets, and they cannot equip most two-handed melee weapons. The third race is, of course, the humans. Humans are a well-rounded race that can really learn any skill and equip any weapon (except Giant weapons duh)--Frequent updates and the game almost always has an event quest of some sort!--Free beginner mounts! Most new mounts you have to get through paying with real money (we'll get to that in the cons section) but Mabinogi gives new players two free beginner mounts almost instantly! You are given a horse and an eagle, which you can fly. This greatly helps with moving from place to place, and it's better than nothing, even if it may not be as fast as some of the payed mounts!--Homesteads are pretty neat! Mabinogi has Homesteads, which are basically little farm type things that you get for free, and as you level it up (by planting crops on farmland and harvesting them for Kon, which is basically "Homestead Experience" to level it), it gets bigger at certain levels. There are plenty of homestead items to add, and it isn't all just for show either! You can add a fishing hole to your homestead that you can actually practice fishing in, if you can't be arsed to find some watter somewhere, and there is also a furnace, anvil, loom, spinning wheel, etc. that are all useful for practicing your life skills. So if you have all these things and you don't want to find the crafting station in a public place, just enter your homestead and there you have em.--SUPER friendly community! Sometimes in Mabinogi you WILL have to ask for help. That's just how it is. You're never gonna complete Generation 1 (Saving the Goddess) solo. You're gonna probably have to recruit a few higher level people to help you out. This is why it is good for the game to have a good community, and it really does. I have never run into another Mabinogi player who trolled/hated/made fun of me (Hm.. except that one guy I kept beating in ... Ah well, he was just a sore loser). Everyone is super nice, and even if you ask for help and it sounds like it was a "stupid question" (there are no stupid questions) players are very friendly and will help you anyways. It is nice to sometimes just sit around a campfire with players, playing music and chatting, maybe sharing some food prepared by another player to get the bonus that it gives.Now we're gonna get to the cons. To be honest, in my personal opinion, there aren't many cons.--Limited freedom of movement. Unfortunately, there is not much freedom of movement in Mabinogi. There are set areas that you can go to, but you are limited to that area only, and if a hill is too steep, you cannot climb it (and it's probably the edge of the area) because there is no way to jump in Mabinogi, unless you include the little jump thing you can do when you have an umbrella open, but that's not at all what I mean... Also you can't swim, there's an invisible wall when you go down to a water source, so if you want to swim in Mabinogi, you'll be disappointed (I was.. lol).--Still a great free to play game, but there are a few microtransaction things that are a bit of a con. Obviously this can't really be helped, I mean, how do you expect the game to make money if players aren't paying real money for at least SOMETHING in the game. The only ones that disappoint me are mounts and homestead items pretty much. Some homestead items cannot be obtained in any other way than by going through a microtransaction to get Pons, and using Pons to build the homestead item. I can understand this with the Homestead Stones, which you need to build things on your homestead, and you get 10 per day, per homestead stone, or even with the animals you can get with Pon in order to harvest their items (wool from sheep, eggs from hens, etc.)  but with DECORATIVE things you really should not have to pay real money just to decorate your homestead. Yes there are some decorative items you can get without pon, but they are mainly just trees, shrubs, etc. Things like cookie trees and lanterns and such can only be gained with pon.      -Ontop of that, mounts are mainly gained through microtransactions as well. The only mount I know of that isn't gained via microtransaction and isn't one of the starter mounts is the Pegasus, which is gained by completing all Saga Quests (which, by the way, are F*cking hard). It's a cool mount, and I would be satisfied if I had one, but some players may be disappointed in the fact that all they get for free is two beginner mounts and, if they work for it, a Pegasus mount. But like I said before, I understand the game has to make money, even though it may suck.--Somewhat complex combat system. Okay so let's start by pointing out that when you get hit by a mob on mabinogi, regardless of size, you will pretty much, almost always, be knocked back on your A$S. That being said, the reason why the combat is a bit complex is because if you are fighting a group of enemies, it is very easy to become overwhelmed by them without the proper skills or use of skills. If you do not learn how to counter enemies' attacks and use the defense skill properly, you will be knocked over quite a bit. Trust me, I would know. It took me forever to get used to using counter, defense, and windmill to counter my enemies' attacks, and I used to always get tossed around the room. This is particularly annoying when you are a much higher level than the enemies and they are only doing ONE damage to you each time they hit, as this just causes you to be tossed around like a pinball and you can't even die, so you pretty much have to try your best to recover and kick their a$ses before your mind explodes from all the stress of not being able to stand back up before another enemy in the group hits you again.      -All that being said, the best way to go into combat is to AVOID aggroing more than 3 or 4 enemies at a time if you can help it.

												This game is wonderful. Do whatever you want, go wherever you want. Keep the wiki open in another window though, because the game does a poor job of explaining most things. I don't mind that though, the 'reasearch' element is pretty fun if you're a hardcore RPG fan. Only problem with this game is that combat versus multiple enemies can get annoying quickly, as you can only block a few attacks, and if you've got 2 melee and 1 ranged enemy targeting you, you'll probably get stunlocked to death. If you're a roleplayer and you've got friends to play with you though, this game is life-changing.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 25, 2015
												It's a good, casual game. Not for heavy upgraders and character maxers. It takes a long time to get up in levels, months, years, just to get where you want. It is fun, though, with so many options. You'll never really run out of things to do. It's more like you get tired of not having enough people around to do all that you can do.The first Saga is a must to finish, for the free pet. You get free pets, but each character can get a free pet from the saga, and the inventory is worth it. Always make your characters on the same server. Get a human first for free giant and human cards. And to anyone who says money is hard to get, it really isn't. Do events, sell your potions, and get a gold talent for hard-mode missions (with some strong people to drag you through it, and pick up all the gold they leave).

content:
Posted: December 6, 2014
												Its a great MMO with a of lore and has a relaxing feeling to it. You can become a warrior, Mage, Alchemist, Fighter, Cook, Bard, Ninja and a Gunner all at the same time while exploring dungeons to defeat the boss which is usually monsters from legends or even demons. The world of this game is so vast that you would have to teleport or fly with a pet to get to the next area, but isn't as huge as World of Warcraft universe. This game includes events where you can obtain lot of hard to get prizes that can help you throughout your adventure. The event iteams include rare clothes, weapons and etc. There is also an in game market system in the game where your can buy a wanted iteam or even sell a rare or need iteam by the price that you decide. Leveling your character take a long time since there are no level caps in this game considering the large amount of skill you need to train. You can play with friends or in a party with others to pass the time. Overall this is a good game in which that I recommend but to become awsome you need to put a lot of time into it.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 7, 2012
												Garbage piled up on more garbage built upon the sub-par foundations of more garbage. Its not a true RPG, but rather  a life simulater, with combat being a means to collect materials and money to buy pots and brooms and other such things. Its incredibly grind heavy, the enviroments ,though cell shaded and quite pleasnt, have a mixture of both High Level enemies mixed in with Low Level monsters that punishes players for trying to explore, griefers and goldsellers are abound, and the game actively pushed you to buy needless garbage. The only redeeming quailty I can say about the game is that the promotional character has a huuuuge pair of breasts, complete with exaggerated breast physics. All in all, for a true RPG experience rather than a Life simulater about making gloves shearing sheep, I suggest Vindictus, a prequal to Mabinogi thats based on the source engine and has an emphasis on combat. All in all 4/10

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 2, 2015
												First, let's start with the obvious. This game is free to play, doesn't require a powerful computer, or much hard drive space, and it's free. Why not do yourself a favor and give it an hour or two, see if you'll like it? I really didn't think I'd like it; I'm generally not interested in this kind of stuff. My hours demonstrate that I did in fact find that I do enjoy Mabinogi, quite a bit. I think you'll like it too. Now, this will probably get long-winded. You've been warned ♥ If you won't or can't read all of this, know that Mabinogi is a fantastic game, with a curiously diverse community and a continuously changing series of old and new events designed to draw in and keep both new and experienced Mellitians. You start out creating a character. Create a Human, with your 6 free character cards, make 6 humans, all on the server you choose to play on. I play mostly on Tarlach, and would have used the 6 free cards to put them all on the Tarlach server had I known this before. So, for each human you make, you'll be able to talk with the leader of the elves, and giants, and support that respective faction. With each human character (but only one of them per day) you can choose to support one faction each irl day, which gives you a new character card for that particular race. Your 6 human characters then become 18 characters, 6 human, 6 elves, and 6 giants, which gives you more bank tab inventory space and a higher maximum gold ceiling for the bank.You'll be able to "rebirth" once a day until one of your characters hits a cumulative (total, including levels from previous incarnations) level of 1,000. After which you'll be able to rebirth once every 6 days, each time you'll be able to change your gender, skin color, facial features, age, the talent you choose will give more experience points, and you'll be able to rank up skills for your chosen talent faster also. I advise that new players first pick close combat, because the most crucial skills for survival can be found in the close combat talent, such as Counterattack, Smash, Light and Heavy Armor Mastery, Sword Mastery, stuff like that, that will help fortify your stats like Strength (helps determine your base dmg) and raises your HP (health points, or hit points, whatever, the number that means you're KO'ed when it hits 0). After you've gotten slightly accustomed to the camera and character movement of the game (it's a little awkward at first), you'll maybe want to find somebody in nice clothes that looks like they know what they're doing, and strike up a conversation. Generally, Mabi players are for the most part generous and helpful. Don't be surpirsed if it seems like somebody doubts you're a newbie, as some rather experienced players ocassionally troll as newbies with underdevoloped characters, for the lulz (I've done it too). Don't be worried about what you should be doing, because there's really nothing you're supposed to be doing, other than whatever you feel like doing. You can focus exlusively on doing main quests and sagas, or developing your combat skills, or cooking skills, or tailoring skills, or running commerce, or you can just stand around and chat with others, or run Shadow Missions in an alternate plane of reality for gold, experience, and other goodies. You can play however you like, at your own pace, and never spend a dime. Although, the things in the cash shop are not actually necessary, they're for the most part nice enough that you might end up saving up for some things (they're generally not very expenisve though). You can join a guild, or form a guild (guild creation is reserved for paying players), you can rank music related skills and put on a concert, or you could spend a good amount of time just exploring the large and varied world of Erinn.Mabinogi offers a great plethora of potential avenues, and being free to play, I cannot in good conscious recommend against trying Mabinogi. What do you have to lose? Come play with us, we're having a great time!

content:
Posted: September 23, 2014
												Definitely one of the best MMO experiences I've had. Mabinogi allowed me the freedom to♥♥♥♥♥♥around, to explore and discover things on my own. It won't hold your hand a ton but that's not to say it's brutally difficult. You really just do find your own way in its world.I had to leave it behind cold-turkey because I got addicted for nearly a month straight. It was just so cool to do trade runs, gather materials for crafting, attempt and often fail dungeons because I suck at combat... if I recall correctly the last thing I was doing was collecting creatures so that I could transform into them.I met a lot of interesting folks. One player posed as a dog and just barked and followed me around for a day. He helped a friend and I complete a tough dungeon and generally made that day's experience a ton of fun.The game is a bit antiquated in some respects but I was easily able to look past that and have a good time.Give it a fair try, maybe with a couple of friends, or make a couple of new ones in there. Or go solo if that's what you really want to do, maybe take pictures and do a blog about your journey.Just settle on down and play yourself some Mabinogi, bro. Enjoy it.

content:
Posted: September 26, 2014
												I've gotten past being a newcomer, even though I'm still technically a "newbie" due to my total level being under 1,000. But so far, I've explored many talents, but the one I like the most is a tie between ninja and medicine. Thanks to my friendly guild, awesome friends and the diverse world of Erinn, I've found Mabinogi to be worth the time and effort. The events are awesome, and my current favorite was the SAO one! Although I'm on G3, I look forward to reaching G10 and on. The stories behind the Generations is, in itself, interesting but confusing when you start G1. I'd have to say expect the unexpected, and always be ready for fun! What really makes this game fun is the guilds and the community itself. I love my guild, Mythical, and I feel completely at home with it. With that said, I recommend trying at least one talent at a time to so you can find your perfect life for Mabinogi.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 21, 2015
												I have played Mabinogi on and off for years, yet it still is always able to draw me back into the game sometime down the road with new interesting content. Although I have only played 200ish hours on steam, I have played since before the release of "Pioneers of Iria" (appx. late 2008 - early '09). The Pros: - many many skills - no specific class restrictions ( you can be a dual-sword-wielding, fireball-ing, gunslinging, musical chef if you want ) - most items can be dyed to what colors you wish - Most, if not all, storylines have been streamlined - Addition of Talents, which are like titles for how proficient you are in certain skill sets (i.e. combat, magic, music etc.) - The Saga storylines give your character a chance to be a part of "episodes", like a tv series. - Continually seems to come out with events / updatesThe Cons: - Pets are extremely hard to get these days without paying cash - In some areas, on some channels, the LAG IS REAL. - Cash shop items are EXPENSIVE. For example, buying a 15,000 Nx pet? That will be $15 US. - The economy of gold seems to be rather pricy on certain, desirable items. ( 20 million+ gold for a set of "eh" wings ) - Dyes are expensive. Overall, I'd recommend Mabinogi with a 8.75/10. There are some issues, but aren't there issues with every mmo out there? And although this game is "old" ( 2006 release ), it's still alive and kicking.

												I'm sure for those that it works for, this game is a lot of fun. It looks really neat and I love the idea of being able to choose between being an adventurer, or just chilling and going for a more relaxed alternative like becoming a chef or a tailor, or a farmer and fisherman/woman. Unfortunately, the game keeps freezing for me repeatedly no matter what. After creating my character, it froze while loading me into the world to begin. I couldn't find any way to close out of the game, as nothing on my keyboard worked. So I was forced to shut down my computer just so I could close the game. Still hoping it would work, I tried loading it up a second time and I thought it was fine. I could move around, perform actions (Like laughing, greeting, dancing, disapproving ect) but I heard no background music. So I found the Menu button and tried to hit Options, hoping I could turn the music on and maybe figure out what I ought to be doing. Unfortunately, when I hit Options, my game froze once more and I could find no means of escaping. F1-12 buttons didn't work, neither did the Fn keys, and not even the ever reliable Escape key let me get out of the game. I am not sure if its because this particular mmorpg is popular, and therefore it has terrible and severe lag....or my laptop just can't handle it. Which I would sincerely doubt, as I have Windows 10 on my laptop, and it's a Lenovo ideapad Y700.It's really a shame I couldn't get the game to work, it looked like it would be a lot of fun and I was really looking forward to the idea of creating my own homestead.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 5, 2016
												Mabinoji is overall a well polished game. The graphics and theme are appealing and I found this game very fun to play. However, I have always had a problem with it's quests. Sometimes, they tell you to return a quest to an NPC, and they don't tell you where the heck that NPC is. I am sometimes really frustrated by this. Also, this is not a game that you can play solo. The dungeon's difficulty increases exponentially. The first maybe two dungeons you could do on your own, but anything after is nearly impossible without a party. Also the inventory idea in this game is terrible. You have like 100 inventory space in your bag. Tht doesn't sound too bad right? Think again. The Items aren't limited to one inventory space, so I often have to throw things away just to get my reward for my quest. This feature does make the game more realistic, but it makes the game feel less and less fun. The storyline is pretty good, but it is hard to follow, because you have to complete a dungeon to get to the next storypoint. And as I mentioned earlier, you just can't solo it. This game does have many problems, but I would definitely recommend playing it.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 22, 2016
												Hadn't been playing any MMOs in a while and then I found this. I would only recommend this game to those to has the time  to play this game. Mabinogi has varieties of systems and endless gameplay depending on what kind of player you are. But If you're a new player who wants to get into PVP right away you'll never be able to compete with players that has been in the server for years. Players that's been in for years are basically gods when it comes to pvp. Just don't bother trying to be the top PVP-er.Been playing for at least 2 weeks and i'll just list the pros and cons.Pros:-Fun-Various of systems ingame that'll keep you busy-Friendly players who are willing to help you and teach you (So far i haven't met a♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥-Complex systems but at the same time once you get the hang of it you'll realize that its awesome.-Admirable and adorable stuff in it. If you like anime and dressing up your character in various ways this game is for you.Con:-Some stuff you have to actually use cash like pets. But you can get them through hard work which takes awhile if you have no time to grind.-This game is a grind fest. To get strong or craft better things you have to grind for it. In layman's term grinding is basically training to get more experience for your character. This game is the so time consuming and addictive once you get into it that it'll consume your soul and you'll be like FFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFUUUUUUUUUUUk . . . there goes another day . . . . .-Exploration experience is a B***H to obtain. Its one of the things I hate in the game cause you have to actually take hours of your time to grind for Exploration experience just to level your exploration level so that you can get your AP.All in all its a fun game. Just remember your the player. You're in control of the game not the other way around. Don't be played by the game fam . . .

content:
Posted: June 24, 2015
												EDIT 2: This game is quite interesting to the fact that you can learn other skills and talents by using the item associated with the action/talent. For example:I use a bow "You have gained knowledge about the Archery Skill!" I read a book on magic,"You have gained knowledge about the Lightning Bolt Skill"! I don't have too terribly much expierience with MMORPGs,but I still think this feature is great. Being able to become a Martial Arts Mage,or an Alchemist Archer,or an Chef Knight. and so forth.EDIT 1: The video on the store page is what the players of this game dream of.The game is still great,but there's just not a lot of player-to-player interaction anymore. If you want action in this game,you'll have to make it yourself. The servers aren't very crowded (hooray?).Sadly,almost everyone online is away-from-keyboard,BUT there are a few good souls who will be your friend and help you out.ORIGINAL:It's a good game,as far as I've played. It's controls will take some getting used to(space bar,for example,isn't a 'jump' button,but it's the combat mode on/off button).It's a manga/anime massivley-online multi-player role playing game. The Inventory isn't THAT big,not a problem for me,maybe for someone else,but not me. And MAN,you can choose you AGE when you are creating your character,so here's a game where you can kick rear as a six-year-old(I may be wrong). Gold isn't too hard to find,but you'd better be loaded when you go shopping!If you want to know the Plusses of the game,play for yourself,or read someone else's review,BUT PLEASE,NEXON,ADD BACK INTO THE GAME THE PARTNER SLOT!
