number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 24, 2014
												I am going to try and write an endepth and fair review for this game including what i love and what i hate. ill break it down into 3 catagories 1.The Good 2. The bad and 3. The Ugly        So lets start with the good. mabinogi is a f2p game that does not treat you like a second class citizen when you play it. you can earn alot of things most games would make you pay for from either other players or just hard work. The community is also very nice unlike world of warcraft or other mmos ive played. most people i have met are kind and friendly and love to help new players out. A majority of the community seems like weeaboos but hey they are nice weeaboos. The combat system is very unique and is adaptable to almost any play style although some skills are just straight up better than others. almost every class is viable and if you are not happy with your class you can swap it in 3 weeks or 1 day if you are under level 100.          The bad. This mmo used to be predatory. very pay to win and there are alot of things from the past that come to haunt you. for example the generation quests. in order to beat the final boss of Generation 3 you will NEED someone who is about level 1000 or higher to help you beacuse it is a gaint dragon who does massive aoe 4000 damage attacks.  (at this point you will have about 150 heatlh). there are still a few pay to win elements for exampe you could buy a cloud that will heal you when you summon it. sounds alright right? well what if you buy 4 of them? you got a chain of full health aoe heals for the low low price of 60 dollars. Want the best upgrade for your weapon? be prepared to grind for hundreds of hours to repair it or just pay 5$.           Another thing is the economy. Do you wanna study how inflation works in an economy run by 15 year olds? well mabinogi is a great case study. anything remotley nice costs about 200000 to 500000 gold so once again do you wanna grind for hours and hours or do you wanna just buy expensive items from the store and sell them to players? although  I need to preface my gripes about pay to win by saying it is getting better. in fact it already is better in korea and we just gotta hope they keep updating the american version. you can not just grind levels infinetly beacuse the game has a system called rebirthing. rebirthing sets your level back to 1 but lets you keep all your skills. if you do not rebirth once you hit level 50 or so it becomes very very hard to level up and you have to wait 3 weeks to rebirth again. just another annoying progress blockerThe ugly. The art style is ALL OVER THE PLACE. very much influenced by korean culture even though the game is set in a mythical european setting. immersion breaking does not even begin to describe the cosmetics in this game. it is worse than tf2. You play as a bunch of immortal demigods so i guess it makes sense that they copy clothes from earth but still it makes no damn sense. I have alot more to say about the game but im sick of typing so ill wrap it up. The game is fun VERY FRUSTRATING. but fun and hey it is free just be sure to read up♥♥♥♥♥♥on the wiki and make friends and you will have a good time. Do not buy the starter packs on steam they are worthless garbage learn the game before you make any purchases (I apologize for the grammar and spelling mistakes i am to damn lazy to go through and spell check this.)

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 15, 2015
												When one first enters into Mabinogi, it will seem like a simple MMORPG.But it's not, it's like calling TF2 a simple FPS.What makes this game unique is how it gives so many approaches and how immersive it is.You can be a chef that smashes things with a hammer, or a puppeteer who fights by controlling puppets twice your size. And unlike most MMORPGs which take to grinding to make any money or levels, Mabinogi uses an intriguing and original way to avoid this droning method of advancement.While there is indeed content that requires real money that adds on to the experience. Playing it free by itself is still worthwhile and satiating for the gaming palette, especially if you enjoy immersion.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 10, 2014
												I've spent almost two years on this game, and I've gotta say, I'm still sticking around.It's a unique game. Everything can be obtained, and there really is no true p2w. I guess it'd be p2getitemseasier.It's skill and leveling system is different compared to other games. There is no true level cap, and as long as you rebirth, you can keep on restarting from level 1 and getting AP all over again. There are no classes you choose. Simply equip the weapon you want to use, and have the skill. Weapons are unique as well. There are no "Level 50 Behemoth Sword". all weapons can be used from the get-go, excluding racial restrictions.Verdict: It's fun. Try it out if you think you might like it, and if you think you won't, still, try it out.

content:
Posted: May 9, 2014
												To make this fairly simple for those who want to know if this game is worth playing, i say yes...however thats simply not enough to be said about this game, because for all the time ive played video games and what ive labled as a "bad" game this game has... 1.poor visuals: this games graphics are very simple and... like most games that try to do the anime style onto a 3D modle it translates oddly.2. it is buggy as ♥♥♥♥... you see monsters stuck on themselves ALL the time.3. you gotta pay into it to get the most outta it.so by those factors alone, one would think... why waste the time then? Well my inquisative gamers ill tell you why, its been the best experiance i have had with a "fantasy-life" MMO, its strange sounding, especially with the afformentioned problems.the possiblity of customization is insane and the open class system is well done, want to be a knight? well congrates get a lance and you learn the basic knight skills. want to be a mage? well thats covered, want to be a druid that transforms into animals like WoW? well guess what thats in there too.  (not to mention you have a crap ton of things to turn into, from a useless chicken, to a dragon, to one of you favorite NPC's) the games subtle details are very nice like food affecting your weight, ageing and getting taller, your charector looks at a player after they type things in. and the sence of acheivemnt is pretty good in this game, making a weapon for the first time felt REALLY awesome because it was a lagitamently difficult.To make a pretty broad statement about this game this game looks like crap, smells like crap , but tastes like paradise,and im almost certain if nexon did a mabinogi 2, with cell shading, voice actors, and stomped out the stupid bugs... you would be looking at the next greatest MMO

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 19, 2015
												I hate that I don't hate this game. It's like drowning in anime. I'm going to keep this brief, because my 120+ hours logged in speaks for itself.What it's got: A robust system that allows you to do what you want. No. Really. Like, if you want to do stuff and slay the beasts, you can do it. There are even events where you run around and eat food, gain experience, and talk to strangers, and that nets you what you need. It's surprisingly in-depth.Also I can play "Light Up The Night" on a Mandolin, and it gives buffs.What it lacks: Gameplay. Spellcheck. An upgrade to their graphics. Listenable music. A compelling story. Characters that make me care. Sensible players. A stable gold economy. A skip button for cutscenes. Special effects that look good. A proper lighting system. Less monotonous gameplay. Anything that makes any real sense (I'm not talking about "Oh fantasy should have realism, no I'm talking cohesion). Things that involve you in the world (though the Giant/Elf war was really cool, and made me feel like I was actually involved. Giants for life.) Less ugly visuals (though the character portraits are eons better than what they were).And you know what the worst part is? Even though I uninstalled it, I know I'm gonna pick it up again in a year, unless Guild Wars 2 finally saves me from my strange and terrible MMO fixation.If you like MMOs, give this a try. It's unique. It's not good, but it's unique. You might even find it addictive, if you can see past it's flaws, but as it is, there's so many other games you can play, that if you haven't already sunken either a massive amount of time or money into this one, it's not worth much past poking in your head to see what the fuss is about.

content:
Posted: October 31, 2014
												I used to hate this game's guts. I don't know what it was (this was a few years back) - the cutesy character designs, the clunky combat, or the complete lack of a discernable main quest. However, I've recently given it another try - and damn is it a good game.Mabinogi is a sandbox MMORPG published (unfortunately) by the (in)famous Nexon - so of course, it's a KMMO. Don't let that turn you away if you're afraid of the grind usually associated with games like MapleStory and Ragnarok though! The game has rather unique mechanics that keep the game from ever really feeling like a slog. The game came out in 2003 (and it hardly looks it), and has been consistently updated with more content.The game is heavily focused around 'life skills' - generally non-combat skills, such as fishing, tailoring, and even songwriting. That's not to say that you can't crawl through dungeons and slay beasties, however. It merely gives you the opportunity to take a break, play the lute (unfortunately, there's no Lute Hero minigame), mine some ores, or make some clothes. You can even build up a base in what's oddly similar to a Farmville clone in a separate instance from the main world. As you craft, kill, and gather, you'll earn experience both towards your character level and your skill levels. As you increase your skills and advance them with the use of Ability Points (earned from level-ups and quests), you'll also gain permanent stat increases for your character, from HP to Intelligence. These permanent stat gains seem minor at first, but as you start branching out your skills (you go from ranks E to A, then 1 to 9 in each skill), your character will become much more formidable, and you'll unlock stat-altering titles to boot.The most unique thing about the game is the Rebirth system. After your character's been around for a week real time, you can have them be "reborn" and reset to level 1 (and change their appearance if you so desire). The benefit to this is mostly farming AP, but your skills and permanent stat ups remain. Leveling up, for this reason, doesn't take an obscene amount of time.Questing in the game is, unfortunately, rather generic. You'll randomly gain "Hunt" quests (kill quests), but you can also talk to NPCs to start quests that have at least some minor amount of plot to them (though they still amount to fetch/kill quests). The flavor text does add life to the game world, as there's usually some reason you're being told to slaughter wolves or crawl through the local hive of spiders. Along with this are the Story quests and the Event quests. Events are usually to mark a large release, such as character animal transformations, or a holiday. Story quests vary from a Mabinogified version of Shakespear's Hamlet (no joke; it's amazing experience, too) to the typical "the goddess sent you to x" RPG fare. Still, I can't help but smile at the quest complete jingle.Speaking of music, holy Christ in Heaven, this game has a top tier soundtrack. Whether you're adventuring on the open plain, relaxing in town, or slaying beasts in the caverns below, the music is bound to have you grinning or humming along. My personal favorite tune is in Tir Chonal [or however you spell it], the human starting town.Unfortunately, as far as I can tell in my 15 hours of play (I have more off of Steam), there doesn't seem to be any real endgame beyond the Advanced and Expert dungeon crawls. If someone could correct me on that, I'll put a note in the end of the review.Overall, I have to recommend you at least try the game if you don't absolutely despise anime (which this game is drenched in the cologne of). It's a fun game, and you have nothing to lose but temporary computer space.

content:
Posted: June 29, 2014
												Despite the amount of hours shown on my Steam account, I have played Mabi for the past 4 years through Nexon. And, I can tell you, it has been one of the best experiences ever.When I discovered Mabinogi through a friend, I was doubtful. I never really liked RPGs other than the FF series, but this game made me change my mind. Yes, it does have its bugs at times, and can lag a lot if you do not have a top notch computer, but the adventure and vast world make it all worth the while. Mabi has a very, VERY big world which has been growing for the past few years, so you'll never be bored by the everchanging scenery. There are literally an unlimited amount of quests to help you level up until you reach (probably, unsure since I haven't bothered to level very much) Lvl 900+. It is also extremely addictive if you have friends who are willing to play with you regularly. Most people on Mabi are friendly, so asking for help and befriending strangers are easy.In all, I would give this game a 9.5/10.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 26, 2014
												Mabinogi is a game where you need to be able to spend time, energy, and sadly for most gamers (ages 12-18 [generally): money. Otherwise, Mabinogi offers what is told by most game descriptions, age, unique combat, and plenty of costumes from any in-game event. Its certainly different from most MMORPG games, but if you want an easy anime life, then you'll need plenty of NX to spend. Either way, the dungeons have a decent difficulty curve, and the story is told in chapters, letting your character grow and develop on the way to the ending. The ending, however, is discovered after hundreds of quests you'll have to complete, and having friends to accompany you is very well recommended, and not just by the game. Some quests are near impossible without some comrades......and I speak from experience (damn golems.....). Mabinogi features plenty of skills to learn and master, and some of them aren't even combat related! Mabinogi is an MMO is one of those games you should play when you want to try something different, maybe even to play to meet some new friends. Either way, its your fantasy life!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 22, 2014
												An MMO that falls just short of perfect, it has basically everything you would want in an MMO:-free form character creation that lets you constantly build your character's strength, forever-a wide array of awesome to goofy mounts-a pretty large open world-a complex crafting system that provides useful items-player homesteads where you can craft, farm, decorate, etc-a long and constantly added to story broken up into arcs that can actually be surprisingly well written-constant updates that add very significant features-frequent events that can be pretty fun-many different ways to play, and fun minigames to play, some for daily bonuses (ie - rafting, alone or with friends try to steer a raft down a river and used ranged abilities to kill goblins on the shores attacking you with magic and arrows, some melee ones will jump onto the raft and attack as well!)but there's some downsides that you should consider before you get into it:-pets and mounts cost money, although they do give you some basic ones for free now. limited edition ones can be powerful and extremely useful for certain kinds of crafting and playstyles so it's hard not having them sometimes-the combat is based on manipulating skills to counter the enemies and when you start it'll be hard to figure out what enemies are good to fight despite a "combat power" system that's supposed to help, it's not really accurate-it takes a loooong time to build up a decent amount of power, and if you start with magic good luck with that, some of the spells can literally take you years to get if you're trying to get them alone because you need extremely rare drops from hard dungeons-the game can be extremely confusing at first because almost nothing is explained well, they've started adding more in-depth tutorials but you'll still have a hard time figuring out what to do as a newbie-some people will be seriously turned off by the goofy cell shaded anime art style, but the screenshots are on the store page so you can see that for yourself. It can be seriously worth a laugh though when you see something like the pelican pet's running animationsin the end though the game's sheer volume of content that's surprisingly high quality overpowers the downsides so once you get into it the game's very good for being mostly free. I've played it since it came out in 2006 and I've probably spent $60 tops on it, and most of that was not needed to be competitive in gameplay.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 7, 2014
												Among all of the MMOs and online multiplayer games I have played over the years, Mabinogi is truly a one of a kind game. Originally debuted in 2004 as a pay 2 play and transitioned to a free 2 play in closed beta, Mabinogi started off small with only a few towns and already had a ton of features that existed today. Though my only gripe as that even though it's a free to play game, you really get the benefits of the game by paying out of the wallet. Even though people say you don't need to. Over the years Mabinogi has tried to solve this problem by elimating some premium services and letting more free 2 play features into the mix.Now compared to 2004 there is always a lot of content. People who say who say it's "a generic MMO" haven't really looked deep into the game's mechanics and features. It's rare you find a game where you can use your own music in battle, or find a ton of minigames like you'd find in here.Still that doesn't mean that between 2004 and now this is now flawless. I still gripe about inventory space for free 2 play players. You most likely will be forced to get a pet eventually for lack of inventory space or buy their VIP service for more bags. Also their durability feature on equips is most frustrating, especially when it's not 100% chance that you might repair an equip completely. Some times even with a high-end computer lag might hit you as well, but that's unfortunately on the server end of the game. Also some quests can be a pain to do alone.But all of those gripes don't take away from the fun of the game. I highly reccomend playing the game through it's main and side quests for at least a couple weeks and join a guild and see if you are still enjoying the game.IGN: YuenRuairi server

												While the gamplay is unique and a breath of fresh air from all the WoW wannabes, this game has one major flaw.. and its not the game, but the company that manages it. Nexon is horrible at maintaining this game, Servers have constant lag,  and there customer service is even worse, if you have an issue with a game, only the god you worship can help you, because Nexon will never get back to you, and if they do, its going to be a canned response thats not going to help you at all,Despite what game companies claim, this game sadly isn't free to play, sure you can get started for free, but to  have any REAL fun, your going to have to sell your soul and open your wallet to get a few pets or mounts, the speed and extra storage space is MANDETORY in order get far.Regardless of the flaws in management, and the really childish graphics, Mabinogi is probably one of the best and most unique MMO's out there,  with its elements of gameplay, story quests, super powers, and no class restrictions, its a shame I have to be so negative about it. If you can round up some friends, or are social enough to make some friends in-game and got 20-30 dollars to spend, you'll be looking at an adventure that can last a year.P.S and pray to your computer that you never run into a technical problem

content:
Posted: March 26, 2015
												Mabinogi is a complex fantasy world with a vast array of customization, from combat skills to life skills, and highly varied levels of equipments, abilities, and upgrades. My only criticism is that it is easy to lose to the "freedom" that the game gives you, and not be able to focus on a goal because of the willingness to explore so many different areas. There are a bunch of tutorials and beginner boosts to get you going and the many seasonal events keep the game fresh. Gachapon style awards in the cash shop are a pain, but every once in a while... you may get something nice. maybe. The story is very deep, so pay attention! Its definitely well thought out and well worth your time.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 8, 2012
												Mabinogi is a very open ended MMORPG with multiple main quests to play, lots of dungeons and events, lots of weapons and cool swag to snag, and lots of NX goodies... which thankfully isn't as required with the new updates. It's F2P, more so than ever these days actually. The game still suffers from lag, but it always has suffered from it. I blame the largeness of the game and the Fergus maintaned servers that are probably older to begin with. The game has customization that was almost unheard of at the time of it's creation (which is what really drew me in), and it still is pretty massive in terms of how unique you can make and build yourself.Lastly, an absolute blast with friends. It can get a bit boring and tedious alone, but find a few friends who play in real life, or find some friendly faces in the game, and you are in for a great time.Original circa 2012: This has got to be the best MMORPG I've ever played, sooo much fun with friends! There's so much to do, find, level, earn, many paths to go, etc!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 2, 2015
												Pros:Do what you want- This game has so many skills the player can learn, both combat and lifestyle. What I really like about this is that if you are a warrior and you want to learn magic, of course you have to level it up but you don't lose your warrior skills or have to change to a different "class" like in other games. just switch weapons and there you go.  Combat- Rock, paper, scissors. Although that is much more engaging than other games where you just point and  click. Art Style- cute child friendly anime themeCommunity- one of the only mmos i know where random people would give an absolute stranger some items if they are new to the game. Even spend time explaining/ helping that person out if they have questions. This is from my own experience, results may vary.For new players- After making a new account, you do start with 6 character slots. Although if you are a returning player that made an account before this update, you are stuck with 1 (or 3 depending if you got the human, elf, and giant cards for free).Cons: (personal opinion)Combat- pretty slow pace since combat is more strategy than button mashing which might not go well for fast paced action lovers. Besides that my only issue is that the combat isn't very friendly to 1 versus crouds. you may counterattack one enemy but if another attacks on at the same time, it gets annoying. Then if you have enemy archers in mix, be prepared to just sit there stun locked.Graphics- I do like anime themed games and this isn't really a con, it's just that i wish they would update the models and animation to something that isn't early 2000s. Cash Shop- Im not sure since I dont look at the cash shop much but from what I can tell, most of the cash shop items are PURELY FOR AESTHETICS which i have absolutely no problem with. I dont this this game is anywhere close to pay to win which would make sense since I think this game is more social than competative. My only problem was that the "style tab" (armor put in the armor/ inventory tab effects defensive stats, armor put in the style tab only effects what your character looks like) which is usually free in other games you have to pay for in this one. Also once ingame, you only have like 10 costume sets to pick from everything else is cashshop or event. Grinding- SInce this game is more social than competative, there is no rush to become stronger than another person making grinding pointless. But if you are a person that wants to level their skills as fast as possible BE PREPARED, it will take a while.

												I've gotten past being a newcomer, even though I'm still technically a "newbie" due to my total level being under 1,000. But so far, I've explored many talents, but the one I like the most is a tie between ninja and medicine. Thanks to my friendly guild, awesome friends and the diverse world of Erinn, I've found Mabinogi to be worth the time and effort. The events are awesome, and my current favorite was the SAO one! Although I'm on G3, I look forward to reaching G10 and on. The stories behind the Generations is, in itself, interesting but confusing when you start G1. I'd have to say expect the unexpected, and always be ready for fun! What really makes this game fun is the guilds and the community itself. I love my guild, Mythical, and I feel completely at home with it. With that said, I recommend trying at least one talent at a time to so you can find your perfect life for Mabinogi.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 3, 2015
												Obvious flaws this game has include a very non-standard control scheme that takes a good bit of getting used to, a large amount of exploitable cash shop items, preiods of long grinding that occasionally become necessary, the worst customer support I think I have ever seen in my life, and a community filled to the brim with elitest♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥with little or no interest in helping new players adjust and progress at all and a pretty limited endgame. (if you can ever get there)Overall, however, dispite all its grevious shortcomings, Mabinogi is an amazing game. It has a massive pool of content and the options for character customization are as close to literally endless as I have ever seen in any game before short of going old school and playing D&D or some third party variant thereof. Something that I tend to use as a selling point is the games lack of a level cap. Basicly how it works is leveling up gets you ap, ap gets you skill ranks, skill ranks give you permanent stat boosts. Once per week you can rebirth, which resets your level to 1 but lets you keep all skills you ranked and all the stats they gave you. The game keeps track of your "total level", which is exactly what it sounds like, the total number of times your character has leveled up since creation. On average a powerful player can gain 100 levels or so each week between rebirthing withut any trouble, each level up grants you 1 ap, each skill on average takes 200-300 total ap to get to the maximum rank with extremes ranging from skills costing only 50 total to costing 500+ total. There are enough skills in the game that the total number of ap required to max out every skill is so high that my level 6500 main character is nowhere near achiving this, and I have participated in enough events that reward ap or double the ap gained on level up (events which are held pretty frequently) that my total amount of ap gathered is likely closer to 10,000. In addition to this they release more and more skills all the time. With this system the game rewards veteran players greatly as your characters power never stops growing. (this is even used as a theme throughout the games story) This means that with this game, unlike a game like WoW for example, the people who have put the most time into the game will be much more powerful then those who started only recently. In WoW particularly there is no diference in character power between a character that was created back at the games birth and a character that was created only a year or so ago. This does, however, lend itself to one of Mabinogis not so obvious flaws. With the way the level system is set up, considering the games age, it makes starting out seem like kind of a hopeless situation. Even my 6500 levels is relatively low for the age of the character because I have taken breaks due to events in my life or simple distraction by other games. This can be discouraging to players who, after their first few hours of gameplay, are most likely only level 30 or so if their not being assisted by stronger characters. This is, however, a problem that has in the past been addressed and adjusted for and likely will be again in the future. As of right now there is a feature in the game that gives new players whos total level is under 1000 items for easier transportation throughout the game world, items to assist in combat, free permanent ground and flying mounts, free premium service and the ability to rebirth every day rather then every week. This means that for your first 1000 levels, roughly 1/7th of what I accumulated over the course of 5 years, your progression is increased to 6 times regular speed (players over total level 1000 can rebirth only roughly once per week, every 6 days is the exact time) on top of being given other things to speed up the flow of the gameplay as a whole. This game also has a very involved and extensive crafting system and a huge range of options for gear customization and enhancement. In some cases, with good enough gear, a characters damage can be multiplied by 10. My critical hits average 12,000 damage, if I had fully upgraded and reforged gear (which takes an insane amount of time, in game gold, luck, or cash) I could potentially get criticsl hits of upwards of 100,000 damage. Currently I dont believe there is anything in the game that requires gear that good but getting gear of that quality is nearly impossible. (though I have seen it in action a few times before) Upcoming content for this game will be focusing a bit more on the endgame content, however, so we may one day in the very near future see content that does require the most carefully crafted gear possible.I would absolutely recommend that anyone with a computer capable of running this game relatively well give it an honest chance. Break that total level 1000 mark and play after that for a while and youl realy start to get into the meat of the game. Our community could use more new players who will stick around for the longhaul. If you want to play with me personally I play on the Ruairi server and my characters name is Blortad. Its worth mentioning that the 1300 hours I have logged on this game is only my play time over the last year or so since I started playing through steam. I have been playing this game for over 5 years, nearly since its relese in the United States, so bear with me if I go a bit too fast for you at first.

content:
Posted: February 11, 2013
												Mabinogi is a very drab game. It advertises endless possibilities and mountains of content, when in reality the only real things you can do involve trading and stabbing bears. The combat is too lopsided, the story is too KAWAII-DESUUUUUU~ and the economy is a huge mess. Dungeons are boasted as in-depth and randomly generated, which they are (kinda). Small enemies can kill you just as quickly as you can kill them, and bosses require a couple of players (or luck, in most cases) to beat, which kills it for me because I like being able to solo most things. Armor does nothing, surprisingly, and you're better off saving your money up for weapons and potions than splurging on armor. There's also a wound system that requires you to use bandages before potions do any good, forcing you to waste even more time. Everything is a grind and nothing is rewarding. Good luck getting anything done. Trust me, you'll need it.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: October 31, 2014
												I used to hate this game's guts. I don't know what it was (this was a few years back) - the cutesy character designs, the clunky combat, or the complete lack of a discernable main quest. However, I've recently given it another try - and damn is it a good game.Mabinogi is a sandbox MMORPG published (unfortunately) by the (in)famous Nexon - so of course, it's a KMMO. Don't let that turn you away if you're afraid of the grind usually associated with games like MapleStory and Ragnarok though! The game has rather unique mechanics that keep the game from ever really feeling like a slog. The game came out in 2003 (and it hardly looks it), and has been consistently updated with more content.The game is heavily focused around 'life skills' - generally non-combat skills, such as fishing, tailoring, and even songwriting. That's not to say that you can't crawl through dungeons and slay beasties, however. It merely gives you the opportunity to take a break, play the lute (unfortunately, there's no Lute Hero minigame), mine some ores, or make some clothes. You can even build up a base in what's oddly similar to a Farmville clone in a separate instance from the main world. As you craft, kill, and gather, you'll earn experience both towards your character level and your skill levels. As you increase your skills and advance them with the use of Ability Points (earned from level-ups and quests), you'll also gain permanent stat increases for your character, from HP to Intelligence. These permanent stat gains seem minor at first, but as you start branching out your skills (you go from ranks E to A, then 1 to 9 in each skill), your character will become much more formidable, and you'll unlock stat-altering titles to boot.The most unique thing about the game is the Rebirth system. After your character's been around for a week real time, you can have them be "reborn" and reset to level 1 (and change their appearance if you so desire). The benefit to this is mostly farming AP, but your skills and permanent stat ups remain. Leveling up, for this reason, doesn't take an obscene amount of time.Questing in the game is, unfortunately, rather generic. You'll randomly gain "Hunt" quests (kill quests), but you can also talk to NPCs to start quests that have at least some minor amount of plot to them (though they still amount to fetch/kill quests). The flavor text does add life to the game world, as there's usually some reason you're being told to slaughter wolves or crawl through the local hive of spiders. Along with this are the Story quests and the Event quests. Events are usually to mark a large release, such as character animal transformations, or a holiday. Story quests vary from a Mabinogified version of Shakespear's Hamlet (no joke; it's amazing experience, too) to the typical "the goddess sent you to x" RPG fare. Still, I can't help but smile at the quest complete jingle.Speaking of music, holy Christ in Heaven, this game has a top tier soundtrack. Whether you're adventuring on the open plain, relaxing in town, or slaying beasts in the caverns below, the music is bound to have you grinning or humming along. My personal favorite tune is in Tir Chonal [or however you spell it], the human starting town.Unfortunately, as far as I can tell in my 15 hours of play (I have more off of Steam), there doesn't seem to be any real endgame beyond the Advanced and Expert dungeon crawls. If someone could correct me on that, I'll put a note in the end of the review.Overall, I have to recommend you at least try the game if you don't absolutely despise anime (which this game is drenched in the cologne of). It's a fun game, and you have nothing to lose but temporary computer space.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 27, 2014
												Nexon saw World of Warcraft, thought "we could probably do better," and then spat out an anime-styled cutesy MMO for the masses to enjoy. I've been around for a good portion of it's lifespan... and through every generation as things grew bigger and I became a smaller and smaller part of the world, I sat back and enjoyed myself more and more. The choices that are there now are expansive and there's so many ways you can build your character. Don't fret, because how you build them doesn't matter! REBIRTH allows for you to start over again at level 0 if you are tired of being range-based. So you can follow your Mabinogi dreams and become a chef or a great mage or even just a fun little bard. Speaking of bards, they have a custom COMPOSING system which allows for one to fashion a song of their choosing/making. The possibilities are endless, especially if you are one for running dungeons like a classic MMO player. One drawback I can see is many parts of the game are locked/hard to get to without paying a bit of cash. Some character customizations are also premium only too, but that's mostly vanity stuff. It doesn't make it pay to win necessarily, it just makes dealing with travel and some skilling much easier, especially with a limited source of inventory slots and hotbars for skills. I still find it worthwhile to pay a little so you can play the game at it's fullest potential. The game is so expansive that I can even recount a time where I was pillowfighting with my sister in Dunbarton as our mounts went nuts trying to devour us. From what I remember, there are Humans, Giants, and Elves for racial picks, but if you buy any pets they not only carry stuff for you/between your characters more fluidly, but they also can be directly playable, so buying a flying mount can make you a taxi as well.All of that I just typed... Only a small portion of what's in store if you're up for it. Seriously, if you are into WoW, it's definitely worth checking out. Just remember that just like WoW, it's best to play with friends... 'Cept here you can go a step further and marry your friends and make them your family. Then go family dungeoning and recount endless adventures across Iria with them around a warm campfire.Mabinogi has events all the time, so it's wise to check in on it once in a time so you get LOTS of free stuff and more to pick from.I give it a 8/10. In comparison, I give a game like WoW a 6/10 due to the lack of a deep and extensive story. Mabi goes, in my opinion, too far to fill the blanks on your experience. Plus with all the events going on, odds are you'll make friends that will explain it all for you. I've had many amazing memories playing this game, and I am SURE you will too!

content:
Posted: October 13, 2015
												This game seems clunky and weird at first. It's hard to really get into any mmo, the first time you try it after finding one you enjoy, but Mabinogi has an... aura to it. It has this unique feeling. I've found no other game like this to a T, as you can with many other MMORPG's. I was horribly depressed. This game gave me new life as I found new friends, went on new adventures and found.. a strange living comfort in my new found fantasy life. But now, mabinogi is not what it used to be. It's okay, it's still great by all means, how ever... I can no longer recommend it with every fiber of my being. I say try it. Try it, and see what you can find that is for you. It's your fantasy life. So it's up to you, to find your own joys, your own story, your own friends, your own likes, your own dislikes. This is a game made for YOU, the player. It's a bit pay2win, but none of it is mandatory for certain things. Pay2get pets can come out in certain events, some items can be found in the market for a hefty price either way and if you wait it goes down. It's a good game. It just.. takes a specific type of person to love it. So enjoy it, if you can. If you don't, fret not. There are other games more suited for you. But I myself love mabinogi. I would say, by all means, give it a try. Sure, some sour spots can be found here and there, but honestly, I say go for it. If you DO play, try mari server first. Fact; Alexina is a bad server. It has the worst type of players on it.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: October 10, 2016
												Played this game since it came out. Lately I haven't been playing much but I'm a lv 6700 alchemist/mage/archer and I gotta say, NOT ONE MMORPG on the market is on par with this game. People complain about the HUD and various little things, but all i can say is that if you have a brain then you'll figure it out in due time and then if you stick with it you will spend thousands of hours just enjoying your own fantasy anime life, and the storyline isn't so bad either. And the best thing, in my opinion... is that once you get into mid/late game you can become a freaking demigod Black knight. It's like your're Goku or something. Fighting a monster that is hard? transform into dark knight or paladin. Still too hard? Equip your transformation with another transformation!!! Now I'm not saying this game is easy because you have all this cool anime stuff because even though I'm at end game there are some things that you just can't solo. Like the black and white dragon.Oh and its super free, in the past you had to shell out money to get pets and flying creatures but now they practically give it away. And they have so many events that most of my pets are now event pets and my gear is maxed out from all the free stuff they give. I IMPLORE anybody looking to find a MMORPG that they can just sink their free time into to download this game, stick with it, and just enjoy yourself. I'm the ultimate RPG gamer and I wholeheartedly support playing this game.Anyways, amazing game spent my whole adolescent years playing it. It really is unlike any MMORPG on the market, not even close.

content:
Posted: July 5, 2014
												First off, if you're into anime/manga-- great! Mabinogi will probably appeal to you with its chibi-esque appearance/graphics. The game has multiple facets (all not included here): you can dungeons, farm, do daily jobs from various NPCs in town, romance players with your music playing abilities. Your character can age, lose/gain weight... and you can even "reset" by choosing the "rebirth" option. Dungeons can be solo'd or done in groups: all set up in a labyrinth-esque scheme.All in all a good game, but it gets a bit repetitive/boring after a while. If you're looking to kill time, check it out: but other than that, Mabinogi doesn't have enough substance in my opinion. The added fact that there is a cash shop available for players that want to get ahead or customize their characters further doesn't help either.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 29, 2014
												Despite the amount of hours shown on my Steam account, I have played Mabi for the past 4 years through Nexon. And, I can tell you, it has been one of the best experiences ever.When I discovered Mabinogi through a friend, I was doubtful. I never really liked RPGs other than the FF series, but this game made me change my mind. Yes, it does have its bugs at times, and can lag a lot if you do not have a top notch computer, but the adventure and vast world make it all worth the while. Mabi has a very, VERY big world which has been growing for the past few years, so you'll never be bored by the everchanging scenery. There are literally an unlimited amount of quests to help you level up until you reach (probably, unsure since I haven't bothered to level very much) Lvl 900+. It is also extremely addictive if you have friends who are willing to play with you regularly. Most people on Mabi are friendly, so asking for help and befriending strangers are easy.In all, I would give this game a 9.5/10.

Posted: December 12, 2012
												Other than having to re-download for steam, this is one of my favorite MMORPGs of all time. I highly recommend it to anyone with little or more MMORPG experience.One of Mabinogi's strong points is the skill system, there's no skill trees, allowing players to train themselves in whatever they want with no skill prerequisites. This allows for amazing party combinations, adapting to your fellow party members weaknesses and enhancing their strengths all at the hands of players and not forced into by the game itself.The quests are all pretty good with balanced rewards, never once have I been dissapointed with a quest or felt that I wasn't rewarded appropriately.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 24, 2014
												Warning: This game, IMO is a WoW killer! Why? Well for many reasons, some more than others. Including:1. The rebirth system: This mechanic is actually the one main factor in all of this. Once you reach the age of 20 years old (Years in this game are weeks IRL), You can rebirth your character back to Level 1. I like this because it allows you to try different playstyles. If you're smart you'll actually invest in a playstyle that you like.2. The class system: This is a trip. See, the funny thing is, You actually don't need to restrict yourself to one playstyle. The only equipment restriction you have is in terms of clothing/armor. Classes instead give you access to learning certain skills that are exclusive to that class, as well as certain buffs. For example, The Mage class allows you to have an INT boost and extra Mana. This is also true for the Generational questline.3.Life Skills: These are unique in that they require a month of two of discipline to master! The variety is in this game. For once Devs kept their promise.Overall 8.5/10

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 13, 2016
												What a game! I first played this game in NA Closed Beta back in late February 2008, and then later on and off again. Every once and a while I played, the community seemed to change as well. Mabinogi is IMO a step up from Runescape, everything is improved and also more Free-to-play. That said, lets get on with the review.TUTORIAL and START:A long time ago, every player was restricted to the human race (which has the most stable tutorials and quests). After the G4,5,6 update, players could play as elves or giants as well (tutorials were a bit flaky). The tutorials basically teach you how to play the game basically, but for more exciting gameplay you would need to learn it on your own. Now, the tutorial for gameplay consists of you clicking on a board and being taught for about 30 minutes how to play in a certain class. For Elves and Giants, there are few tutorial quests before you are sent to copy the human tutorials (Effectively making the tutorials for elves and giants pointless). TLDR: Play as a human, you'll be handsomely rewardedRACES:There are 3 races in the game: Humans, Elves, and Giants. Humans are the most balanced of all, Elves excel in archery, magic, and life skills but are terrible in melee combat, GIants excel in melee combat and alchemy, but suck in everything else. The game is heavily biased towards humans as they get the best skills, armors, and overall stats. Next up would be elves, since they excel on the skills that are most important in the game. Giants get very little, less interesting skills, very little armors, and awkward hit boxes.MAINSTREAM QUESTS AND STORY:Personally I play Mabinogi for its story, since after a while there is nothing to do in this game. It's not like people talk to each in this game (More on that later). G1-3 update introduces probably the most "Play Me" like story. It's about 3 "Legendary Warriors" and how you interact with them. It ends in a very Korean drama like way. G4-8 update focused more on the development of the game, with new races, regions, and flight mode. However it really felt like there was not really an interesting story here. G9-12 probably featured the most complete story with no loose ends, and a lot of interesting features (Shadow Missions, Demigod mode, Brionac weapon, Alchemy). G13-16 destroyed the game and ruined the reputation by essentially copying Shakespherean plays and putting Mabinogi characters into there (You know when you know something Nexon does will be bad, and it really does comes out bad). G17-18 made the quests episodic and increased the amount of "Drama" in them, with the return and ruined reputation of the "3 Legendary Warriors". G19+ has been almost a revival of the game, where it seems the developers are trying to actually make some original content for once in almost 5 years.TLDR: There are a lot of different mainstream stories. They all seem to be modeled after K-Dramas, and almost all the NPC characters' reputations end up terrible as you progress through the stories.GAMEPLAY:The gameplay is incredible for when the game was released (2003 in Korea, which is 13 years ago). You can do almost anything in this game that RPGs offer, in addition to music making (The most unique feature of this game). The AI in this game used to be actually interesting with each enemy fighting in a certain pattern. As of now, all enemies just chase you and have their HP buffed to insanely high amounts. There are many different styles of fighting (Melee, Archery, Magic, Fighting, Alchemy, Gunnery, Puppetry, Ninja, Lancery). However they are not all balanced, so there are some styles of fighting clearly more advantageous than others. Crafting in the game consists of (Weaving, Tailoring, Refining, Blacksmithing, Cooking, Winemaking, Synthesizing, Metal Conversion, Magic Crafting, HIllwen Engineering, Mana Crystallization). It is really a grindfest just to participate in crafting in this game. MUSIC MAKING:The best and most unique feature of the game. You can compose music with Mabinogi Music Language and play it in the game for the community to hear. Of course every just copies their music from some where else. Some people actually put effort in the whole playing music thing in this game, where they buy a piano and play really complicated songs. For that effort, I am confused why those people would not just learn to play those songs in real life.LAST OF ALL, COMMUNITY:The most important thing about any MMORPG is its community. Mabinogi has had different groups of people play the game since I began playing it. In the beginning, a lot of players were new and there was a lot of adventuring in the game. Today, it has mostly ceased except the the Alexina server. Usually most people who are active in the game will be elitists who play with other elitists. The majority of the players in the game just AFK in Dunbarton trying to sell stuff for hours on ends. If you are a new player who wants to play this game, I heavily advise you to play on the Alexina server. Obviously this game is heavily involved with anime. That said, there are alot of weaboos present in the game (YOU have been warned). Also, "Fashionogi". Everybody invested in this game seems to have millions of pets filled with endless amounts of clothes to prance around in.RECOMMENDATION:Taking all these into account, I do recommend playing this game for at least a few hours to see what it offers. Today this game probably can not compare to other games, due to its aging graphics, maintenance, and dying community. A lot of players I have met over the 8 years I played this game have moved on to newer games. Mabinogi will forever be one of the greatest games I played (probably due to the time I played it, when everything was still new). That said, I probably would hate this game if I played it for the first time today. Because of all the new content, I have been slowly distancing myself from this game. It won't be very long until I myself completely quit the game.If you are looking for a more action based game with similar backgrounds, try Vindictus. It's the prequel of this game, but a lot entertaining to action based players with short attention spans.

												Edit: A more serious review of this game is that it is a fantastically bland looking generic game that has a wealth of depth in what you can pull off and put your time into for the game.I've never experienced a game that made me feel like I could do as much as I could playing this and nowadays despite the age of the game getting to itself if you can look past the janky buggy movement and gameplay you'll see the charm it holds.A more serious note on progression of this game is that it is surprisingly not that Pay2Win formula other reviews tend to give you a whole plethora of new player friendly content is out to ease the transition and the most you would ever feel encouraged to spend on is a mount or a pet for extra storage. The one argument that can made is that all the tools to make oneself into a stronger and steamrolling character exist but to feasibly pull this off would require hundreds if not more of real life money to pull off.If you ever plan on making it far in this game please be aware that the game treats skills and advancing as a slow more methodical approach with being consistent about your intentions to raise and level which can turn some people off if they're too used to MMO's since progression is more usually linked to gear/level progression.

content:
Posted: October 29, 2016
												In the past, it was a great game that pushed for community.  As it grew, it became more and more solo focused.  The combat system was designed to be slow paced.  Would definitely recommend this game for those who enjoy developing their characters into a one-man killing machine.  Or those who just love fashion, or looking cute, or love to afk in towns.Recommendations for in-game:- Number 1 thing to do is: Visit the wiki, get an idea of which path you would want to start with.- Start by focusing on your life skills.  They will improve your combat abilities through passive means.- Rank each skill up one by one so that you can achieve Rank 1 in each.- Take advantage of your newbie status by resetting your Rank 1 skills so that you have more AP to rank another skill. (Recommended since you will be free to rank your skill back to 1 without training again)- Talk casually with people, ask and let them lord over you as if you need shelter from an invisible enemy. (There are good people who are understanding and make recommendations for skill paths or training methods, others will try to shove their methods down your throat)The Good (presently):- Game is largely solo-able since a large part of the community seems consist of isolated groups.- Story line is ok if you don't care how they butcher some mythological characters.- Combat is unique, inbetween fast and slow pace.  Used to run on a Rock-Paper-Scissors sort.- Life skills are extremely tedious, but is also the most rewarding.- Large variety of pets.- Huge map filled with life.The Bad (presently):- Community seems to be extremely immature and isolated.  Many are obessessed with PvP.- Skills are in no-way balanced for PvP while patches try improve the PvP scene.- Heavy on the Pay-to-win scale.  Pets are now stacked with beneficial buffs or attacks when summoned. (almost game breaking)- Group are hard to find for dungeons or challenges for new players.  Not many are willing to have a character that isn't stacked in their groups.- Latest Patches have made their gorgeous map into nothing worth exploring (very little reason to head out there and kill mobs)

number of helpful: No ratings yet1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: March 1, 2015
												This game is fabulous and bad at the same time. If there was a neutral button toward a review, this would be the one game I'd use it on. Here are some pro's & con's.Con's first, cause' it will grab your attention at the very finest.PS: , I mention this later but, I have around 2500 hours on this game and I've played for four years. Don't take my hours on the steam platform for granted please :)Cons:*BAD support, as far as I know, only half the people in their customer/tech support system actually do their job.*Money-hungry company, this game is 'considered' a pay to win due to the mere impossibility of doing things without money near-end game, but it's still a great experience otherwise.*Not much customization, in outfits, near early-game, which is rather considerably okay how they deal with it. Not really a con.//Some of these con's deal with the company that franchises it, the gameplay is, heavily, HEAVILY, different.Pros:*Epic combinations of skills that will leave you on your seat when you happen to get that unexpected boss kill ;D*Best community out there for a [mainly] free2play game.*Grand amounts of customization near mid-game, leading to epic skill combos, neat outfits, tools..*DUAL WIELDING, do I HAVE to explain this? They handle it so well.*It doesn't feel like a grind in the beginning or middle, near late game is where grindy stuff happens.*Memorable times...!*A VARIETY of amazing skills such as fishing, making a campfire, cooking even! These were added to make the game more realistic and overall bondworthy toward. It also makes some killer picnic's.*Realistic-like PVP , or, in this case, Duels. You literally walk up to someone, ask them if they want to duel. A menu comes up, you set the pre-requisites straight forward and get dueling. You aren't FORCED to do it either, and you can make good friends off of it.*Graphics are easy to render, a lower-end / mid-end computer could easily run 30-100FPS. The game was made around 2000-something if I recall. The graphics still look amazing though.//*Death penalty system is not degradeful, hated, or anything in particular. It is annoying when you die, you get Nao stones to revive on full health sometimes though, and even if you do die, you don't lose anything. There is a chance when you die you may lose your gear if its expensive and not blessed by a certain item, but you can get it back at a town hall for a .. 'reasonable yet sometimes a pain in the♥♥♥♥♥ kind of price.//*And finally, its NOT a rage game. Well, not easily alas. Sometimes there are mobs that can truly p1ss off someone but other than that, you don't lose very much.//\\Oh and, don't take my hours for granted. This game was just recently platformed on steam, it used to be on the companies website, which doesn't, as you may know, transfer hours over to here.I've played Mabinogi for four years! Highly inactive, but I at least have 2500 hours on the game and I've witnessed all the stuff they've done on it.//\\This is a more TL:DR Version::!!//\\There are plenty more cons to the game, but they are outweighed heavily by the amount of pros this game contains. The community is so well knitted together that even a child could have fun without any pervs or foul language to watch out for. It's fun, engaging, and most of all, it's made for a community. You can manage epic combos in combat, you can even have pets. Its pretty cool, and is definitely worth trying.However, the support service/s are typically bad, but you can still manage a refund if you didn't get something you payed for. They are money hungry , as they support many different games imported from Japan, and I can understand that. When they ask for too much money though, its pretty noticable. Back on the topic of the game though, there isn't much customization in the beginning, so its kind of boring. If you keep on going though, you'll find it pretty epic overall.--//...An even more TL;DR version..!! ;//\\Fun / Engaging game; but has a bad support service / company. It is a near pay to win at the end, but it is still very fun. It's also very involved with the community, most people are friendly and you don't have to watch out for swear-a-holics. A 9 year old could play this and learn to be kind from the community, most of the time.//OVERALL SCORE, the moment you've been waiting for..I give this game an 8.5 / 10  !!The reason I knocked off 1.5 points was rather simple, just the bad service and company it is owned by in America and the 'noticable yet not overkill' hunger for money they desire to keep the game rolling. Here is a more in-depth explanation.+1 - Great graphic design, even for a game made near 2000. It can also handle lower-end computers well.+3 - Epic community for a free-to-play game, it is very well knitted together, its hard to rip apart. Very hard.+4.5 - Amazing combat system, PVP, and gameplay in general. Has a killer storyline too.-1.5 - Aside from all that, the game has a bad support system and is a mere pay to win near the end. You can still have a great time though.Thanks for reading through this, I hope I've told you the most I could about this fabulous game.-~Kon

Posted: August 2, 2015
												    Community is ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ now most guilds require rediculously high total levels with two alternatives which happen to be new guilds (which usually die given a few weeks) or guilds with so much drama involved you'll be wanting to leave in a matter of hours. The skill systems suck now. When I first started playing mabinogi years ago the skill system was perfect the enemy AI was actually intelligent and made the game difficult which was FANTASTIC. With the addition and revamping of so many skills and now getting AP for talents it makes the game hilariously easy.   Sure hope you like spending money! Because if you like to save your money, back the ♥♥♥♥ away now! This game is pay to win and I should know as I've spent more than my fair share of money on this bucket of crap. Pets are basically useless now. Before it was difficult to beat the game without some kind of pet because the difficulty curve actually existed. Now Nexon is coming out with pets worth $12 that ♥♥♥♥ing SING ALONG WITH YOU.   Sure hope you don't like customer service when it comes to nexon. One of my accounts was banned years back for no particular reason and I sent a ticket in and I never heard a damn thing about why my account was banned. So within a span of about 3-4 years I sent in a total number of 15 tickets and NONE of them had even been touched by the ♥♥♥♥♥♥ cutomer "service" representatives. There are also absolutely NO refunds here. Trust me I did try to get my money back from wasting at least $200 on my at the time recently banned account.  The events are ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t and are recycled every year. You're lucky if you happen to see an event from a few years back and that's what they say is "New and shiny events" more like trash that they shined up for you so they could stick it up your♥♥♥♥♥easier. On occasion they'll add a new event but generally it's so boring you'll wish there were no events. Mabinogi makes it now so that there is ALWAYS an event but it just...It just doesn't work.All in all the game just isn't all that fun anymore. I certainly would not recommend it anymore.

												I have played mabi from the first generation and on and off for every year, sometimes doing speed runs on different characters. It's not the same as the older versions but it's still good. The client is low spec so you can multitask while playing and the gameplay is reactive and somewhat player skill based early on but at higher levels it might not be as fun. The best part of this mmo is the character customization. In the past I delete all my characters to start over with all the  customization features for free, but I don't know if that works anymore. It's a good mmo to create a character you like and play with.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: October 27, 2016
												I personally enjoy Mabinogi, It's got the same MMORPG Stuffs, But its very unique in its combat. You have your basics; Attack, Defense, CounterAttack, and Windmill. Windmill is the unique part, Its like a AoE Melee Leg Sweep Attack, And of course you have your class skills and weapons! Theres honestly so much to do in this game! The only downsides are; Because of this games unique playstyle, some may dislike it right away. I also got bored after a long time of playing, (About 9 months I'd say) But after awhile, I always see myself coming right back in to start the process all over again. Overall I recommend this game to any people seeking a new MMORPG Anime Game. And if you even read this far into this, if you are intrested in this game or not, I'd do insist you download and try it out for yourself. First-Hand Experience is the only way to really get how this game works. Have a nice day!

When I was very depressed by some events, these friends of mine helped me up and brought me to be more open and be more social. The Gameplay is also very fun, this game updates atleast once a month. (keep in mind this is an 8 year old game) This game is the game of infinite possibilities, I am a giant that wears an alpaca mask and flies with purple butterfly wings. This is the game that seems to go on, even as a person that has never spent money on a microtransactions, this game changed that and I spent $75. This game is really fun even without spending money, the money is so you can get specials pets and even butlers and maids. This game is also very well made and doesnt take a powerful computer to run. I reccommend starting to play with friends, but you will end up with more friends after you find the right people. My guild has moved on to other games than just this one. I see very few flaws with this game.9.5/10 Gameplay10/10 Social Aspect8/10 Questing

												I've been playing since Generation 3 of Mabinogi and currently it's at Generation 20. This game existed before steam, so my hours should be like 10k+. Anyways this game has undergone massive changes since then and so far the only downside are the reforges. Other than that your character can be whatever the hell it wants, but if your character dies because you spread your ability points too thin that's on you (my experience). You don't really need those reforges, but it makes everything easier. If anything playing with your friends is better than soloing. It's an MMORPG to it's core, but your not limited to the classes. Your class just helps you with training things faster and a few stat bonuses. Pay2win is more like doing ridiculous amounts of damage that's all.

content:
Posted: June 23, 2016
												Playing Mabinogi is one thing I'll never regret. The memories I've made playing with friends I made will probably be some of the most long lasting. Honestly the community made the game for me. Playing Mabinogi solo will definetly start to get boring after a while, as most of the solo content is a grind fest other than the Saga. So I would definetly recommend trying to reach out and make friends to play with. Other than the community, the game was alright. The fighting style is unique and different than most MMOs out there. Plus there's a lot of space to move around in as they give you opportunities to "Rebirth" which allows you to change your class or proffession and restart yourself to lvl 1 while keeping all of your previous stats. But I would highly recommend sticking with a combat class to start with in the beginning as it's always nice to have a a certain class that you can lean on. Another thing that I liked about this game is that the devs keep a constant amount of events to do every now and then to help keep you entertained. They also interact with their player base occasionally getting on, or through events where you can spend time with them. And if you ever so wish, you could also stalk them on twitter if that's your thing. But the devs in Mabinogi are probably the most interactive I've ever seen in an MMO. They also have interactive NPCs which I find pretty interesting. All in all my experiance with Mabinogi was mostly postive. Reading some of the reviews from old time players, seeing them leave is honestly a bit sad as it's thanks to them that we newer players are able to experience the best out of this game as some of them spent their time putting a whole bunch of info on a Wiki for us, so if you decide to play I'd definetly recommend you check it out. Mabinogi might not ever be as it once was for them, as their expectations may have been shot down, but for new casual players, I don't think it should be much of a problem.

content:
Posted: June 18, 2016
												Well, where to begin? This game has aged poorly in the aspect that it doesn't run too well on modern systems. Otherwise for being 8 years old it has a fairly active (and friendly) community. To this day it still sees updates and varying other things. This was one of my first MMORPGs (the other being Fiesta). Seeing it grow and change has amazed that something can run for so long. I wish they would've released Mabinogi 2 (not that Vindictus♥♥♥♥♥♥ so Mabi could continue to run for another generation of gamers. But onto the actual review and not nostalgia. This game is a very unique MMORPG being advertised as "you can be anything!" And it doesn't lie. You can be a singer, a battlemage,  a archer, or a combination of the varying amounts of skills in this game. The levelling system is unique as in you can level and then "rebirth" your character which results in removing your current levels but you keep your skills. Your levels are, in a sense, saved in a total level. Mine being about 500-700, is fairly low, especially seeing as I have friends who have multiple characters at 4K+ levels. One of the downfalls is the sort of need of pets because you'll eventually run out of space. Going onto another downfall is how poorly it runs on current systems. This game was made 8 years ago and it struggles to support current-end parts. The community, when they aren't AFKing in Dunbarton or wherever, are usually super friendly and are willing to guide you through almost anything. One thing I do miss is some of the people I used to play with when I was a lot younger but dropped Mabi due to IRL things and lost contact with. But even then, I've found new friends who in a sense replace them but are completely unique from my original friends. All in all, if you disregard the graphics, this is an amazing game that truly needs a reboot on a new engine.

content:
Posted: December 22, 2014
												I'm going to re-write my review of this game, just because it has changed since I played it. Unfortinitly, my thumb is still going to point twords the floor.  This game has a good sized world, it has many skills, and over the years has had some very nice improvments and new content. It also still has many bugs and while new stuff does get added and older programming does get changed at times, older textures and meshes rarely ever get updated, specialy if they involve wearables.   I wont go over skills and such much, I recommend trying the game for yourselves for that, but I will warn you that this game is not great at being pay-free as some would like to say, as pets ($), while unneeded, are about as unneeded as a car is, it's not a great idea to advoid them. There are boosters and the such you can buy with money aswell, but most of these actualy are not needed unless you're looking for a edge, but pvp is kinda a dead joke in this game. Then you get Nexon's -Amazing- customer support, of which I can only assume work at EA as well. Really, you -will- get problems with them eventualy, eithor through payment info randomly being perma blocked or through them randomly banning accounts. I have not had my account banned, but I have had friends, ones that don't do stupid stuff, get banned for no reason and dispite many ticket requests never get a reason as to why or a way to defend themselves.   Another downfall of this game is the extream lack of keybinding. while you can shortcut some UI keys, anything skill-related you are stuck with # keys and F# keys. No exception unless you own a Naga, in which case... why are you looking at this game?! (To be fair, I do not own a Naga mouse, and am just assuming the hotkey-program that it uses will works with mabi)    Now, I have a lot of gripes with this game and its p*ss poor support, but I also have a lot of great memories with it. As the saying goes, it's not the game that makes it fun, it's the people, and there is a good amount of good people in this game. As a new player, you also get a good amount of story quests and exploration to do, which I highly recommend exploring the world before trying to save it.   It is not a bad game, more that it is ran by a bad company, which as much as it dissapoints me, is the main reason why I can not give this game a good review, because it is loosing players every year, and Nexon just keeps trying to milk it for money, providing new content as a way to try and draw new players in to their failing game. Unfortinitly, their business practices will not change, and that will keep most new players from staying.

content:
Posted: July 18, 2013
												I'd recommend this game if the homestead houses were actual houses, and that'd be really nice for socializing, but they're not, soooo ♥♥♥♥ IT.The crafting in the game is beautiful, as is the lack of real class systems.  However, I don't particularly like the "bonus exp for talent" system.  Essentially, you now pick a class and when you do tasks from that class, you get more exp.Despite all this, I still recommend this game.  If you like the Anime art style, it's perfectly acceptable to enjoy.  If you don't MIND the art style and would like to play a game with interesting craft and harvesting systems with the ability to master every task in the game, then I recommend it.  However, if you find Anime grating at all on your nerves, you will puke 3 minutes into the game.
